description:
I come here mostly every Monday for the Happy Hour. I love the convenience and fast pace environment. I think the servers are Koreans at this Japanese fast food restaurant, they play Korean music in the background and they speak to each other in Korean. Happy hour prices makes me happy when I am hungry before class . The happy hour menu ranges from $3-$6ish, which is really cheap for what you get. Although it may not be the best sushi you ate, it's still pretty good for its price. There are so many choices to choose from, but I usually get the lemon basil chicken, Alaskan roll, and tempura veggie roll to balance out the portion of meat and veggie. 

Service is extremely quick , it only takes like a couple of minutes once you settle down for a table. They also have a self serve variety of drinks -water, cold tea, and hot tea. You don't need to always ask the waiter/waitress for water , when you can get up to get it yourself ! 

It's my favorite go to spot in the center of downtown whenever I want fast, affordable, and convenient Japanese food!
author: Judy M.

description:
I was shopping at Target on 4th/Mission and didn't want to pay skyhigh Metreon or skyhigh Denny's nearby prices for lunch so I came here.  It looks small from the outside, but the inside is spacious with about 20 tables.  Of course, most of the tables are small but about 3 to 5 are medium to large. 

It's like everybody says, fast casual japanese.  You go all the way inside to the front of the counter past all the tables to the right & left of you, and you wait in line, place your order from the menu descriptions/pics near the counter.  CC is ok. There's usually a  weekday special for under $10 which includes a mini salad, mini soup, and the specified entree with steamed rice.  Or they also have a sushi daily lunch special for under $10 with mini salad & mini soup.  The cool water flavored with lemon or lime slices is free on the left hand side for you to get with one of the metal cups nearby.   There's also heated tea.  Once they give you a card with a number, you go to an empty table, put the card in the metal card holder so that the waitperson can spot you and give you your food.    Everything is carefully organized on every table as far as condiments and napkins are concerned.  You may want to go up to the left hand counter in front for a fork if you don't want to use chop sticks.  

I had a pork tonkatsu wednesday special which was ok cooked and I also ordered a separate NY sushi roll  for $6.50 which was also well prepared.  The NY roll had the cooked shrimp tempura which made it crunchy but creamy with the avocado, cool with the cucumber, and tasty with the tobiko.  The only problem was they served me my salad & soup AFTER they served me the sushi & tonkatsu.  Like I said, it's not a really formal sit down restaurant.  It's a large mixture of express, casual, fast, and only a slightly formal format with a waitperson delivering your food.

I have to say, be careful of coming during weekday lunch times!!  They're spacious but they're also very popular.  Either come early for lunch or late for lunch so that you (and your friends) will have an easier time to get an empty table and avoid long lines.

I thought the portion size of food was on the light side, but at least the variety and affordability are present.  TExpress would not be the first place I'd go to next time if I'm nearby and want lunch, but it's certainly an option if you're stuck in the area and don't mind eating light.
author: Frugal C.

description:
The key here is setting expectations before. It's cheap, fast, and mediocre but decent sushi - like what you'd get in a mall food court. No frills. Place looks like it could be on the edge of a health code violation, but it's so affordable! 

During Happy Hour, I got 5 rolls: 4 of the basic ones like spicy tuna, california,etc. And we got 1 "fancy" roll, I think the dragon? And our total was under $30. The rolls were good for the price - I was expecting it to taste all dry like the Trader Joe's to-go sushi, but it was muuuuuch better. 

It's a good place to go if you have time to kill before a movie at the Metreon. It's right across the street.
author: Thu P.

description:
Love coming here on weekday evenings! It's in between metreon and Westfield mall. They have daily specials that they show right as you walk in so be sure to check them out! 

I just ordered the Chicken Udon and my Boyfriend ordered the chicken katsu rice (that was the Wednesday special) and substituted white rice for brown rice. I love that they do that since I know my boyfriend and I are always striving for healthier meals. We each ordered our own meals because we thought the portions would be enough for each of us, but when they came out with our food, the portions were larger than expected! We each had leftovers to bring home. 

Great vibe and the food was delicious too! I will definitely be coming back here frequently.
author: Nenette T.

description: The California rolls tasted fishy -- the most basic of rolls shouldn't taste like day old fish. The tempura shrimp role was decent... EXCEPT they gave me cucumber peels instead of the nice good part of the cucumber. I couldn't figure out what I was chewing on... every single roll had cucumber peel instead of the good part. Like, the used their leftover on me. Unfortunately will not be back again.
author: Kiffiny W.

description: Coming from Utah I figured even the low grade San Fran sushi spots would be better. This tasty like nothing and it was not fresh. Walgreens has better sushi. Fingers crossed I don't get sick.
author: Chase S.

description: Taste wise, the food is still the same.  But value wise, this place has gone down.  I've watched the price of the unagi donburi go up in price from $10 to $14 over the course of 5 years.  I figure that it's ok, since inflation and minimum wage is going up.  But just today, I went in and ordered an unagi donburi and there's only half as much unagi as there used to be.  They just sliced it up and spread it out a bit to kind of cover that fact up.  And their Tuesday special, the salmon teriyaki donburi is $8.99.  Normal, non special price is...........$9.00.  Wow, you can save a whole penny!  This place is not worth it anymore.  I used to come here a lot.
author: Gordon C.

description: I used to come here a lot, but this time I was very disappointed. I ordered Unagi Doburi and they cut the amount into half. Besides, the side soup was sour like leftover soup. The Unagi Doburi is also like leftover meal. I will never go to the place anymore.
author: Louise Y.

description:
Roll should alway be serve fresh or semi-fresh otherwise don't serve it at all. Yes they are really fast but I wouldn't mind waiting if it's serve the more fresh.  Roll delivered with sauce on the outside container creating a mess.  Threw away the last piece as the avocado looks brownish.
Have some minor stomach ache after.
author: Hilton C.

description:
I've tried a few items here, since my friends love to come here for our Meal Pal lunch. The place looks kind of like a cross in between a restaurant and a fast food place, you go up from to order, and you can take it to-go, but there is seating to eat there too if you want.

I have tried the Lemon Basil Chicken and Chicken Teriyaki, and both have been pretty decent. It doesn't really stand out or anything, but they are palatable and a decent choice if you want that "Japanese" food taste with something sweet with a soy sauce touch.

I wouldn't eat here normally without Meal Pal though, I wouldn't say it is quite worth it, but with Meal Pal I don't mind eating here for a few of my lunches.
author: Tyler T.

description: Fast, easy  and decent sushi. They should change the name though... "express" denotes cheap and low quality to me and most people I think and they are doing themselves a disservice.
author: Sunil R.

description: Is this place under new ownership? Or management? I've been eating at this location for 7 years off and on; I used to love ordering from here, and I hadn't ordered from them in a while, so I decided I'd order a seafood sobe soup for takeout. Whereas the soup I would previously get had at least one large, juicy shrimp, and a fair amount of veggies and radish, what I received today was nothing like I'd ordered from them before, and nothing like what I usually love about SF Tokyo Express. This soup was so sad, with 3 tiny, sad shrimp, and just a small smidgen of fish, and no veggies at all; just a few leaves of seaweed swimming forlornly in a sad little soup. Really disappointed. Something has changed. Not sure what, but until and unless they bring their standards back up to what I've known them to be (for fast Japanese fare), don't think I'll be returning.
author: Stephanie J.

description: You can't really beat the quality for these prices. Obviously not the best I've had but damn prices here are very much below average for sushi.
author: Erik C.

description:
This a fast food style sushi.
Good food and it's for quick dine or take our.

1) Food: selective menu that cover all the basic style sushi... good with limited choice

2) Price: average per person will be $20 to 30 per person

3) Service: ok... this is a fast food style

4) Environment : Clean with setup for fast food style

If you want a quick meal with sushi then this is a place to come by. Don't expect a 4 to 5 star treatment
author: Kalani S.

description:
Another super awesome Chirashi dish. Perfect as usual. 

This time I ordered the spicy salmon roll. It is very good. Even better than the double salmon roll. A must try in my opinion. 

It's Thursday but my Friday so I ordered the Sake which was a nice touch. 

It comes with a sake glass that adds a a nice touch to the casual ambiance. 

The Sake was so good I looked it up and copied a bit of info on the bottle I tried. 

JOZEN AGED
Shirataki Pure Rice Sake
Junmai Ginjo Jukusei Jozen Mizunogotoshi
This perfectly balanced junmai ginjo is full of bright stone fruit like peach, nectarine and juicy cherry and a clean mineral finish that is reminiscent of melting snow.

Perfect meal.

Hi lee recommended.
author: G S.

description:
Shockingly good for this area. Great for MealPal. for quick and easy sushi or take out, 4 stars. if you are looking for a authentic sit-down creative sushi, 3. but you should know from the location this is great for the former.

Great pick for mealpal. love the courtesy kimchi and oshinko by the counter. decent lunch specials and very fast and polite service.
author: Mike V.

description:
Place - Big and many tables in it.

Taste - basic. Nothing special but every menu are not bad.

Place and Service - Fast and cheap. They give salade and miso soup per order. And tea and pickle. Really resonable price. And every day, they offer special meal.
author: Da Won L.

description: They have a solid selection of sushi- nothing fancy, but they have some of everything.  The restaurant is clean, service is fast, and prices are really good for downtown San Francisco.  They also have free self-serve hot and cold tea, water, and kimchi, which is great.  This place is my go-to for quick sushi when I'm in SF.
author: John F.

description:
Order at counter, take number and wait for them to bring it to you.  Simple.

Relatively quick and cheap Japanese eats.

Chicken Teriyaki entree $9.00 add 4 pieces of tempura +$2.00

Not bad food for the price you pay.  Entree comes with soup and salad.  White meat chicken. Grilled and smothered in teriyaki sauce.

They had a daily "special".  Salmon teriyaki donburi $8.99.  The regular listed price is $9.00.
author: Jerry W.

description: Go to sushi place in downtown area. I always get their daily specials. Their staff are super nice. This place never disappoints.
author: Angelina W.

description: I called for a pick up order but one of the cashier was super rude they not even know what they sale or what protein means that was suck I like coming here from Richmond ca because I like the foo but the costumer service is sucks .
author: Loren W.

description: Good food. I ordered one of the daily specials. It wasn't fancy but it was good.  Staff were very nice and the meal was served promptly.
author: Keith M.

description:
I am putting one star, not because of the food, their food is great, but because of the amount of disrespect, and insult their customer service have. By mistake i clicked on pick up rather than delivery on EAT24. I tried to contact EAT 24 and them to solve the issue. Everything seemed fine, until i called the reaturant about cancellation or trying to make it a delivery,m. The tune, and the words that came out of that person mouth is unbearable. Hint, check my account, i never once, even if i was right complained about an order or resturant. I understand they are humans, and everyone makes a mistake, and there is bad days, but just because the customer doesn't understand the rules of who's responsible for the order, dosen't mean to disrespect him, and hang the phone in his face with anger.

Hope this review will reach the owner or the manager of that place, and notify, his workers about being calm in dealing with customer since there is a lot of barriers such as language or the understanding of rules. Yet again THE ONE STAR IS TO GRAP ATTENTION, all my other orders were delicious and satisfying.

Thanks a lot for your service, and I  am really sorry for any inconvenience.
author: Moha T.

description: Nice place for quality/price, but stuff with rolling eyes looks really rude. It was 8:37 pm I asked to eat inside and it was a bunch of people eating. The girl couldn't make decision is it fine or not and at the end she said that this is fine, rolling her eyes, like it is really hard for her to get me. I went to this place a lot and this is my first time when they didn't let me eat inside for this 20 minutes.
author: Iuliia S.

description: Was starving on my lunch break so I came here. Never again. The food was pretty gross. The service is less than appeasing. Only good thing is the eating area was pretty clean. I feel nauseous.
author: Ro B.

description:
I came during happy hour, many options of sushi and appetizers. The Basil Chicken and Dynamite Roll are my favorite. Calamari ring also good. Just FYi, if you have Fivestar don't forget to log in. 
Also they provide kimchee and yellow radish for free. Just make sure to check on the yellow radish before you take it.
author: Maria S.

description: Wonderful happy hour deals!  Every day from 3 till 6. Super delicious spicy crunch roll, $2  beers, and Sakai specials! Worth it for a small snack
author: Tiffany D.

description: Sushi was good, place was dirty. Nothing fancy. Happy hour prices were great! $2 Sapporo and $3.5 California rolls! Good for a quick bite after the mall
author: Callie D.

description: This place is always inconsistent with quality of food. I've ordered avacado rolls many times with soy paper, sometimes they come out like sushi rolls or sometimes they come out looking like giant ice cream cones filled with rice. Also the staff hardly can understand what anyone's trying to say half the time and I have to explain everything to them. They also need to redo the interior decorations looks a little old and cheap
author: Phillip D.

description: Love coming here. I regularly am in this area on Tuesdays so often have the Cali roll special. I also like the seafood udon which I didn't know comes as a soup! It's good big and hot with lots of yummy noodles. Their meals come with a salad or a soup AND salad. Pretty awesome huh? This is fast food sushi so don't be expecting some high class food! It's cheap and good and very fast to eat here. The surroundings inside are comfortable and spacious but this is not a luxury place, it's a place to come for a quick bite. As long as your expectations are in check you're gonna love this place for its ambience, staff, free tea, fast service and yummy food! Go check it out!
author: Zoe L.

description: Conveniently located, reasonable prices, good portions, free kimchee, pickled radish and iced tea, quick and easy, friendly service - can't ask for much more! I love their salmon rice bowls on Tuesdays for about $10.
author: Maile N.

description: Reasonable price for a Restaurant in the center of San Francisco,They have good food and service was fast.Accessible for any commuters.Would definitely come back to this Restaurant
author: Juan S.

description:
This 3-star review comes from the true experience I get every single time I come here, to this location specifically. My girl and I have been coming here for as long as we've known each other, just about 4 years, and every time we are always guessing which roll we like the best. After all those times, we have finally found the one roll that we now know is our go-to, the Asten Roll. Which is a basic veggie tempura roll in your traditional maki-style. But if you're not reading in between the lines, we have tried MANY of the rolls while on this journey to find the Asten Roll, and non of them seem to have a great flavor combo. Just like many "roll" sushi spots in the world, this place only comes thru with average quality. That's why the Asten roll is so good. It's not hard to mess up an easy veggie tempura roll. You must get the spicy mayo on the side as the most perfect dipping sauce for many of their dishes besides the rolls. 
But the downside of this place is the quality of service they provide. To start you off, the order takers/cashiers are always so moody and feel as if you are not spending enough to feel like you deserve a happy-positive customer experience. Also, if you're going to have a sit down restaurant after ordering, make sure you do your job at clearing tables and keeping your eating area nice and clean. At least to the standards of a good enough clean where there isn't food and crap stuck on the tables and the plates are all fully cleared. Multiple times have we had to wave down the runners to clear our table after being at that table for a while, and it was as if no one had been sitting there for hours yet they still failed to clear and clean the table. The only thing that will let that slide in my book is if they are busy. But there has not been one day or night IN THE YEARS we have been coming here  where there's a line out the door and every table is filled. NEVER! 
But hey, come here if you're wanting a basic sushi/Japanese food fix with complimentary kimchi, takuwan(Japanese pickled Daikon), cold tea and water, and hot tea.
author: Nick A.

description: $5 Hot Sake for Happy Hour is pretty cool. Fan of their teriyaki chicken. Not a fan of the ambience inside the restaurant. The doors are always open and the flies love to hang out by the entry way. But for something quick and casual, it's the place to go.
author: Janice Evita M.

description: This was a quick little restaurant near my conference center. The food was served quickly and had a lot of flavor. I ate here a couple days for lunch during the conference and had sushi, nigiri, udon, and their teriyaki plate. Every meal here was delicious.
author: Nicki S.

description:
As others have said this is a fast food style sushi joint. Very basic, order at the counter, they bring out your food to the number card you place on the table. Or you can get take-out I'm not as big a fan of the take-out is seems the soup and salad with the combos are small, maybe it is just the container. 

Nothing fancy but if you are craving a little sushi or Japanese food and don't want to break the bank downtown it will do the trick. 

I'd rate the food at 4 for freshness (sushi) and flavor, the service is average. Once you order the robotic-like workers who bring out your food aren't too friendly, but maybe they just don't like working there? 

No big deal, I came for the affordable lunch not a conversation with my waitress.
author: Richie C.

description:
This is their third location I have patronized and also my fourth time getting sushi for lunch this year.

Sushi is an excellent choice and a delicious lunch alternative. This is when I decided to come in for lunch. I made my choice and put in my order after looking through the menu. Some items I ordered are the Philly Roll and a can of Dr. Pepper. My meal total with tax came out to be under $10 and it's very affordable.

The food is fresh and delicious plus I enjoyed my meal. I tried the Philly Roll at their Stonestown Galleria food court location, it's delicious and I liked it. The smoked salmon is delicious and the flavor blends in very perfectly.

When ordering sushi, a condiment plate is given. Feel the need to flavor up your plate of sushi? Pour soy sauce in to the condiment plate. Dip the rice in the soy sauce or any sauce for flavor boldness.

Overall, very good first experience here. I definitely will be back when I am seeking a place to satisfy my sushi cravings.

日本餐好美味喔，有時去食一餐壽司確實係個好選擇。
Japanese cuisine tastes good and eating sushi is a very good choice.

Some reasons for my rating:
- facility cleanliness
- prompt service
- friendly staff
- good food
- restaurant is easy to find

This restaurant is close to:
Metreon
City College of San Francisco (Downtown Campus)
Westfield Centré San Francisco
Moscone Center
author: Bennett W.

description:
The wait time was good the dinning area is ok
The food was good I got the chicken  I could have used a little more sauce and my rainbow roll looked kinda gross
I got the mix tempura it was good 
And a California roll was standard
author: Rocque B.

description: I was lured in my the offer of an appetizer at 50% off. The place is a fast food sushi restaurant where you order at a front counter. The big menu is on a wall with people lined up behind you wondering why you need to take so long. I order my food and am given a number to bring to my table. The server nearly charged my card twice which I guess was an honest mistake. When the food arrived, the miso soup was fine but the salad was drowned in so much dressing I literally could not see the lettuce. My California rolls were tasty and seemed fresh. The chicken katsu was also surprisingly better than I expected but I was a little worried may have been undercooked. All in all it was fine but given it was first meal since landing in SF I probably could have chosen better.
author: Mark J.

description:
Occasionally I don't mind eating and dining Japanese food, just as long as there is no seafood involve in my meal. 

After a night of shopping in the Westfield mall, I skipped the mall's food court and decided to check this place out, which is only up the stairs on the Bloomingdale's rear on Mission Street. The new Japanese restaurant was a Jack in the Box for many decades. I am happy the Japanese restaurant has eliminated the disturbing patrons that used to allocate in the fast food diner. 

On my debut, I ordered the Tonkatsu Pork Donburi rice bowl. For $8.75, I get fried and panko-breaded pork meat in scrambled eggs and rice. I also get a bowl of Miso soup and a side of salad with my meal. For the affordable price, the rice bowl wasn't too bad. Every item in my bowl was cooked very well. 

For an additional $3.00, I also added a four-piece of California Roll. I only managed to eat one piece of the California roll and it was okay. Afterwards, I did not get violently ill from the lone piece of sushi. 

This restaurant is clean and price is affordable compare to others including the Westfield food court.
author: Matt G.

description: Got the tuna and salmon roll and now i have food poisoning. Be careful!
author: Kayla F.

description: This is an awesome option for casual, inexpensive Japanese food! The poke was so good!
author: Felicia C.

description:
Paying this price，you shouldn't ask for more. I like it. Food are ok with such low price in San Francisco! Definitely will come back:)

But after half hour I finished the food, I felt extremely thirsty. I guess they use too much MSG?
author: Vivian F.

description: The Tuesday lunch set of Dragon roll and California roll is so good and with affordable price!
author: Katy L.

description:
TL:DR Great sushi, Realllllly bad delivery service

FOOD:
Great sushi. I'd give it 4 or 5 stars

DELIVERY SERVICE:
Shit. I give it 1 star. I'm assuming it's not too bad if you order at the restaurant, but I've ordered delivery from them numerous times with several problems. Sometimes it's only missing soy sauce or chopsticks, but often it's missing an entire roll or part of the order is wrong, or they've grouped together rolls when we specified that some should be separate for dietary reasons. Also, it has taken up to 2 hours to deliver only a few blocks away. I understand traffic in the city is bad, but the least they could do is give you some sort of discount when it takes that long. Also, I called in about our missing roll and was assured the manager would call me back and that I should be able to get some money back, but (surprise) that never happened.
author: Nichole S.

description:
After soaking in more art and haute couture fashion history and her-story at the Legion of Honor, I came to Tokyo Express to chow down for lunch and recover from taking a minor tumble whilst browsing at Bloomingdales. Moving right along . . .

I have wanted to try this location of Tokyo Express since reading the reviews of some of my fellow yelpers. I have been to the locations on Spear Street and Sacramento Street back in my working girl days. I used to meet up with other fellow working girls for lunch and girl chat at either one of the aforementioned locations.

The name "Tokyo Express" sounds rather appealing as well, particularly the "Express" part. I did not feel like dealing with the lunch crunch rush at the Westfield Shopping Center. Just like their other branch locations, this one is pretty fast.

When I walked in, I was surprised by the fast-food atmosphere and environment. The interiors had the basic fast food booths, chairs, and tables. I wonder if this was the location of IHOP and/or Denny's back in the day. I was overwhelmed by the size of the place and the fast food atmosphere, not a tranquil Japanese restaurant. The menu over the till and on the wall was just as overwhelming.

Once I was able to get my bearings with the menu, I went with my litmus test of pork tonkatsu, tamago, and avocado roll. After placing the order, the cashier hands me a number, and I can get complimentary green tea and water before I go find a table for one. I sit at a table not too far from the till with other table that can seat one to two people comfortably. Over this group of tables is a large flat screen telly aka television showing K-Pop with the volume turned down.

Food is cooked and prepared to order at Tokyo Express. My pork tonkatsu was brought to me first by a server, and I was surprised that my sushi order was not with it. About five or so minutes later, I see my sushi order yet the server took my number away prematurely. I had to flag him down and inform him that the sushi order on the tray was mine. (And I had my receipt to prove the sushi there was mine.)

I am glad I finally got to try this branch of Tokyo Express. It is just as good as the other aforementioned locations I mentioned earlier. I will be back if I am not In the mood with the food places nearby. 

Kampai! SYOY!
author: Chiara A.

description: Tokyo Express!  You have made the fattest man in San Francisco the happiest fattest man in San Francisco.  Thank you!
author: Justin H.

description: The delivery guy was hit by a car while bringing the food to my apartment. Despite a mangled bike and a few scratches and bruises, he managed to deliver the sushi on time. What else is there to say? I'm giving Tokyo Express five stars because of the delivery guy's determination. I also gave him a good tip.
author: Antone G.

description:
I wasn't expecting much from the decor. It's not dirty, it's just cheap and sterile. 

The lunch special is 4 pieces of nigiri and a rainbow roll for $13. $13!! In San Francisco!! The sushi was not the best I've ever had (I've been fortunate enough to travel extensively and been spoiled by food), but it is very good. Especially for $13!! In San Francisco!!

The staff are very friendly and they offer free water/coffee/ice tea when you dine in. 

Next time I'm in town, I will seek this place out, and you should too.
author: Bil M.

description:
I would not recommend this place, their customer service is the worst. The man who took my order was extremely rude and impatient. I had requested no sauce/dressing on the food I ordered. Sure enough, what ended up happening? Here comes my salad with dressing. Meh.

I kindly ask the woman that bought the food to our table to have my salad with no dressing. She quickly snaps back "Ok! (Rudely) Next time tell them!", then walks away before I can speak. I watched her storm off to the counter and snap at the man who took our order. 

Next thing you know 10 minutes go by and no salad. Hmmmm. I ask the woman about the salads and she stated "sorry we are out". Seriously? My grandmother goes up the counter and asks the man who originally took our order and he has the same response.

We weren't going to let them get off so easy with their lies especially when it was requested. So we waited until both employees were occupied and asked a different person. Next thing you know, I get a salad with no dressing and evil stares from the two people who lied to us.

At the end of the day if you don't care about customer service, try this place out. The food isn't bad but it's not the best.
author: Kira H.

description: I came here with my boyfriend after comic con for some take out. It was amazing to say the least, definitely worth the wait. The staff were courteous and didn't judge us for being in cosplay.
author: Kaitlynn W.

description: This is the first review I have ever written.  This is the place that convinced me to share what's good.  Simple, quick, decent prices, and very tasty.  Will def go again.
author: Richard G.

description:
I was craving sushi so I walked in and I saw a lot of people in there. It is a big place. For some reason it was so so hot in the restaurant. It was miserably hot. The sushi is cheap and tasted cheap but it was bad. I got the Tokyo roll- it said mayo and I thought it meant spicy mayo but they meant real mayo in the roll. 

Bathrooms- available but pretty gross. Two stalls in the women's bathroom.
author: Tina L.

description:
Not the greatestJapanese- but cheaper and less chaotic than eating in Westfield or Moscone!

They offer daily specials and happy hour  choices. Tried the poke during happy hour- too many big pieces of scallion rather than thinly chopped and also a little on the spicier side than you'd expect!

I prefer the sashimi combo which comes with miso soup and salad  or the spicy tuna hand rolls. The seaweed salad is good too. 

it can get quite busy when there is a conference downtown - but just about everyplace downtown is. Fortunately the service is fairly quick. Just wish they listed what are in their different sushi rolls on their wall menu!

Also great for a quick lunch- if you work nearby.
author: Ruby S.

description:
I liked the food. I ordered a lot of food and we couldn't finish it.... 

So I ask for To-go bag but the guy on the counter said he needed 10 cents. I really don't have coins but he really doesn't want to give me the bag even though i already gave him the card to pay for the bag, and started to get mad.... 

I said "so what we gonna do? I can't hold the container by myself.... " Then, he said "in the beginning u should order a bag even if ur eating here so we could charge it to your card...."

Then he finally gave me a bag when I'm starting to raise my voice but before he handed the bag he said this is the first and last time I will give u bag.... Then I said don't worry cause this is the first and the last time I'm eating here... Too rude that's make the place uninviting.....
author: Jxhunter C.

description: This a an affordable sushi restaurant. The food is decent and it is located downtown and within walking distance of the ferry building. I tried the chirashi bowl and the fish is fresh. The donburi bowl comes with a lot of food too and with a curry sauce.
author: Diana T.

description:
3.75

12pm on a Friday, was supposed to meet up a friend here for lunch but ended up going to the wrong location =(  Screw it, imma eat anyways.  

Salmon Teriyaki Donburi- served with soup and salad and self serve water/ice tea.  Rice was drenched in sauce.  Vegetables were still tender which is a plus, and they had zucchini!.  2 medium cuts of salmon.  As my mouth inhaled the first bite, I noticed a weird smell; like feet or something.  Perhaps it was the cabbage?  I had just walked 8 blocks in the rain so feet smelling salmon wasn't going to stop me.

I finished my meal just in time to meet up my friend for another meal =/  

Good service but don't think I would come back.
author: Linda N.

description: The price is cheap and you get a lot of food but the teriyaki was a bit burn and crispy
author: Mike S.

description:
Beware... the way this place is arranged is bizarre.  You go to the counter and order, but then the fun starts.  Seating is all for one WWF style and super aggravating. If you are meek you could be standing there with no place to sit. 

Food is just ok. Never got my salad... even after asking for it twice....
author: Steph K.

description: Food is generally good and reasonably priced. Service is usually good, but the last couple of Saturday afternoons there has been a new woman working there who seems to think her primary job is checking her cell phone while the other two employees do all the work. The service is slower when she is there.
author: Fred S.

description:
I actually really like the sashimi here! Placed my order through Yelp / Eat 24 and the service was pretty quick. However, it is pretty expensive and you don't get a huge serving. 

I've had the Blossom Chirachi, which includes tuna, salmon, and avocado over sushi rice in a bowl. For an "express" type of place, the fish is fresh and I think it's a fine place to satiate that raw protein craving. It's not Mioki, but I feel it's pretty solid nonetheless.
author: Aivy C.

description: The prices are way cheaper than anywhere else and they give lots of fish with their rolls. I like this one much better than the same one in Stonestown. Other places have honestly degraded and gotten much more expensive. It's not to be able to get sushi for better value.
author: Cindy G.

description: I come here for fast an yummy lunch, but my 5 stars is for their fab happy hour. 3p-6p everyday, great portions, awesome prices, solid menu. Highly recommend!
author: Loralyn S.

description:
Looking for a decent Japanese place for a quick lunch/dinner? This is the place.

1) First Impression
It was Saturday, close to 8:30 PM after the Super Bowl City / NFL Experience.
It didn't seem dirty and had some nice decoration.
There was only 1 person in front of us in line and a lot of seats were open.
The menu was quite overwhelming at first because everything seemed $15+, but then I saw the Chicken Teriyaki for $9 and ordered that.


2) Wait time
Receiving our food for a party of 5 was quite fast and arrived within 10-15 minutes.
They give you a number and you are supposed to sit at a table and they will serve the food to you. However, you have to order up front at the counter first, so it's kinda like a fast-food restaurant styled place. The time went by faster because you can get your own water / tea near the counter and bring it to any table by yourself.

3) The Food
I actually did not have high expectations coming into this restaurant, but the food quality was actually better than I expected. Compared to every other restaurant, this place actually had the largest portion of Chicken Teriyaki I have encountered in a single order. However, keep in mind, this could be due to the fact that it's not really bento-styled and did not come with any rolls and tempura, but just Miso Soup, Salad, and 2 Slices of Oranges.

The Salad, in particular, I believe had a peanut sauce/dressing and was quite unique, but very good. There did not seem to be too much rice in comparison to the Teriyaki Chicken.

Keep in Mind: 
*It may be due to the time, but this neighborhood is definitely not the best and I did not feel completely safe here.
*The waitress/cashiers didn't seem to the friendliest but did come by a couple times to collect our dishes and such. While leaving, she was at the door and did not greet me until I thanked her and left.


*Final Verdict*
If you're in the area and you're looking for some quick Japanese food, then this is where you should go. It wont amaze you, but it definitely will satisfy your craving for Japanese food. Even though I did not try the sushi, the Chicken Teriyaki was quite delicious.
author: Jeffy Y.

description: I stopped by this Tokyo Express location for a quick bite before catching a movie at Westfield Century.  I ordered their Teriyaki Chicken Entree (http://bit.ly/1KNHt0V) and as expected, they served a very hearty plate of Teriyaki Chicken and it came delivered to my table very quickly along with a small bowl of miso soup and a salad.  As just like all the other Tokyo Express locations, they live up to their namesake with decent Japanese food and fast service all in a clean restaurant.  You can't go wrong with eating here if you want to satisfy your sushi, bento, or donburi cravings without breaking your wallet.
author: Rodney H.

description:
My friend and I was exploring San Francisco one day when we suddenly got hungry and decided to stop here and check it out. With its close vicinity to the mall, this was an ideal place.

The atmosphere here was very homey. I thought it was pretty cool how they arranged the inside of the restaurant. Later, I found out that they didn't have air conditioning and only had fans - which covered only about 30% of the patrons.

I would say that it was borderline cheap here, but it's ridiculous that an extra curry with your order was $3 and what's crazier was that you can't order curry itself.

Another factor that led to having this place such a low-rating was the rude female employee that took my order. She gave me and my friend this look as if we we're asking for too much.

The food was great though! I had chicken katsu and it was amazing! The texture of it in your mouth tasted right. It wasn't undercooked nor overcooked which was great!

Would I come back here? Eh, maybe. Would I recommend this to a friend? We'll see...
author: Aj C.

description:
I ordered chicken teriyaki over rice n salads n soup was included.  I opened the salad and it looks like someone ate out of it. It was gross!
The chicken smelled  Cow Manure..discussed w smell....
author: Ms R.

description: Food was pretty salty. Everything was. Especially the California roll of all things. Chicken was a little bit on the dry/burnt side. Price was ok although I would have expected a little bit better quality for a $12 lunch.
author: Dan N.

description:
You come in, stand in line to order and pay, they give you a number, sit anywhere you like and they serve you your food. They have cute deco and presentable plates. Easy, quick and cheap! The only thing I don't like about this place is when it gets hot, it's a little musty inside so I usually sit by the front door. Other than Im sold! 

I don't come here as often as I used to because I've discovered other sushi spots but their pretty good! They're in a really convenient location and one of the busiest spots of east SF. Their raw sushi isn't as fresh as others but it's cheap and full-filling. I come here for their generous portions of salmon teriyaki, chicken teriyaki, miso soup is tasty and jumping tail roll is packed with flavor/crispy goodness! Their happy hour is a must here! Happy Hour: 3PM- 6PM I think it's every day. Happy Hour choices of $3 Lemon Basil Chicken or Chicken Wings or Calamari Rings, $2.50 Seaweed Salad or Basic Hand Rolls, $5.50 Hamachi Kama (fatty collar of yellowtail fish), $5 5 piece sashimi sampler, $6.50 Nigiri Sampler and choices of hot sake- cold sake for $2.50-$6. They might have updated their menu since last time I've gone so I might not be as accurate. 

Give this place a try. You wont be disappointed!
author: Sharmaine M.

description: cool chill place minus the bums lol,..
author: Dylan C.

description:
Dropped by Tokyo Express spontaneously with a friend on a late Saturday afternoon around 3PM. There are many empty tables at this time of day. This restaurant can definitely accommodate a lot of people based on its size. As you walk past the tables that take on the arrangement of a "food court" vibe, you reach a counter where you can order your entree.

The woman, who I assume is also the manager, was actually not friendly at all. She lacked a smile and definitely looked like she did not want to be there. I ordered a Chicken Katsu with Curry, but she misheard me and charged me for a Chicken Katsu. When I corrected her, she wasn't apologetic about the mistake, but just waited for me to pay the extra fee for curry. She also threw the table number card at me in a very unprofessional, uncaring way and she pretty much set the low standards of customer service at Tokyo Express.

However, what changed my mind from rating this restaurant a 2-star to a 4-star was the kind gentleman serving our entrees. He was very kind and hard-working. Props to him for smiling throughout his shift and not looking like he hated working there like his boss!

As for the quality of the food, I really enjoyed my Chicken Katsu to be honest. It was much better than your average Chicken Katsu for two reasons - tender chicken meat and fried to a perfect degree. The katsu was not dry or dough-y like other katsu entrees I've tried. $3.00 for a bowl of curry is a bit steep of a price in my opinion and I kind of wish I didn't order the curry - there was nothing special about it. They have plenty of sauces on the sides of each table to use, ranging from Tonkatsu sauce to Sririacha to Soy Sauce and more. As for my friend's entree, I tried his Chicken Teriyaki dish and wasn't impressed at all. In fact, I was a bit disappointed. The chicken was much tougher and drier than the chicken in my dish and left an unsatisfying feeling in my stomach.

If you're looking for quickly served food, this is definitely your pitstop. The food is adequate, but don't expect great customer service here (except from the nice male worker who helped us today!)
author: Michelle S.

description:
Surprisingly good. The sashimi was super fresh and tasty. 
The seating area is ok and the outside sign looks worn down, but he quality of sushi is on par with the place in Yerba Buena gardens. For about $25 you can get a decent sushi lunch. This is a great place for take out if you want to go to your hotel room and work on your meeting presentation.
author: Zak R.

description:
I came here during happy hour and the line was extremely long. It's a good place for a group of friends because you pay for your food first rather than splitting the bill. 

My friend and I wanted to dine in but there were no clean tables available. It was a extremely busy day so we ended up finding a small table near the door. Then the waitress brought over my food. I got two rolls, Gyoza, and a Sapporo. The spicy roll was no good. The philly cheese was not bad and the Gyoza was overly deep fried. There was barely any meat on ythe inside. 

The food was bland and had no flavor to it.. But what do you expect from a fast food sushi restaurant in the middle of downtown! I'll probably go back for the $3.50 large beer
author: Meliza M.

description:
If I could give 0 stars I would. 
If you're not from around here, your stomach will suffer, tastes slimy and poorly made all around. You're better off eating Safeway sushi, it's cleaner and leaves no aftertaste.
author: Alexis D.

description:
I like this place cause it's spacious, clean and organized. 

The service is great and super fast! That's my favorite thing whenever I'd like to eat sushi  

Got a sushi combo and was actually enough for 2 people. 

Hope you guys enjoy!
author: Abdulwahab J.

description: Perfectly adequate and reasonable Japanese fast food option. Pleasant service.
author: Jethro B.

description: I normally take my food to go as I work near by. I call in my order and it's always ready when I get there. No long lines and food taste great. This is my normal goto if I'm wanting sushi while at work. Quick, friendly service and food is fresh!
author: Ivan M.

description:
An interesting place to say the least

Is this a fast food place? You order at the cash register, and they give you a ticket number afterwards.

Is this a sit-down place? You sit down at actual tables and wait for the waiters to bring food to you. The interior is nicely designed, with appropriate furniture and bamboos and decorations that are better than some of other sit-down places I've been too. The sushi is served in a professional manner on decent plates and bowls, which is much more than I can say for other sit-down places I've eaten at. Also, the sushi is pretty good.

I am confused.

Definitely recommend stopping by if you have a chance.
author: Henry L.

description: My wife and I absolutely love this place. It's one of the only places you can go to get Japanese food in the middle of the day (no break between lunch and dinner) at a very affordable price. We used to live near Mission St and would go here all the time. Their Lemon Basil chicken is fantastic. That's how I got hooked on this place. They had someone hanging outside offering samples. Hook, line and sinker. Plus you can still get sake and beer. Can't argue with that. If you're headed to Mezzanine for a show, the MOMA or going to the movies, hit up Tokyo Express first.
author: Asahi Y.

description:
When you're in the city and craving some quality sushi but don't want to spend too much so you can order more than one roll. This is your place. It's a hole in the wall that I think a lot of people overlook because its not in an appealing location, but I've gone out of my way to come here when I have the time to and especially during lunch when it's busy everywhere else. 

If you know what you like, you just walk up to the counter and go ahead and order. Walk all the way to the back and on the right wall side is a huge menu of theirs, if you don't. 

I gave them a 4/5 because the drawback I didn't like was that their beverage station on the left doesn't look too sanitary especially the serving cups. I'd be cautious of the lemon wedges as well since it's out in the open but I'm not sure if they cut them while using gloves but that goes for any restaurant!
author: Stella M.

description:
5 stars may seem like a lofty rating for this unassuming hole-in-the-wall of a Japanese place. This is not haute cuisine, this is not hipster paradise, this isn't even somewhere you'd bring a date (well, I would). But when I sit back and think about it, Tokyo Express nails everything I'm looking for in a quick bowl of udon. 

Ordering at the counter saves me time. They have a large menu, but admittedly I only go for the udon. A more-than-enough bowl of Chicken Udon is $6.59 and comes with a small side salad. For right across from the Metreon, that's an f-ing steal. Service brings you your food, and they've always been pleasant. Last time I went the guy said "Hi" before handing me a salad, which sadly threw me off guard. 

The ambience is nice enough (nicer than usual considering pricing), and there's free hot green tea. The location is pretty great, but again, don't go in expecting a Michelin star. They do what they do well, and I'll surely return next time I'm in the area.
author: Laura B.

description:
The sushi here was ok. I've definitely had better but for the price it may be worth it. My boyfriend and I purchased 6 different rolls to make sure we were giving it a fair shot. 

If you're out and about shopping near Powell and feel like you want to grab some sushi then I would recommend this place but if you want something that is going to amaze you then this might not be for you.
author: Priya S.

description:
This falls into the category of "good enough" sushi. It's not the best quality but it's definitely not the worst fast-food type sushi I've eaten before in my life. Basically, you get what you pay for. 

We'll order for pick up and orders are always ready on time and staff is always friendly and accommodating with picky instructions for certain rolls. If possible, I like to go in to order to see their specials of the day. Sometime's you can get 2 rolls, miso soup and the quintessential side salad for $9.
author: Leina K.

description: This place had a low rating on yelp but is really good and fast. The ambiance is very cool as well.
author: Yuni G.

description: I went there for an early dinner. I ordered an entree chicken katsu with curry. The portion was massive. The chicken was hot and crisp and the curry was yummy. It came with miso soup and salad. The customer service was fine and the food came quickly. They could do a better job of bussing tables more promptly, but overall it was a pleasant place to have dinner.
author: Laura H.

description: My dad loves this place. The food tastes good but the restroom was a bit dirty.  Foods are so far affordable:
author: Kat P.

description: I always come here in tokyo. I don't have any problem with the food or anything. The problem is the employee especially the guy in the cashier and also the woman in the cashier also. They are extremely rude. Their attitude need to change it comes to customer. I worked also in the same position dealing with customer but I respect and be nice. Don't make fun on the customer.
author: Jhonna C.

description:
Argh. Annoyed. I am staying at the Marriott Marquis and this sushi place was right around the corner on Mission.

The restaurant is large and roomy and seems clean enough.

I ordered takeout with extra wasabi. They did not put in the extra wasabi and they also did not add the miso soup that I ordered. So there is that.

The fish is cut VERY thinly (for nigiri) and the rice balls underneath are huge. The fish itself was sticky and mushy. It was disgusting. I will never go here again. This was absolutely terrible sushi.
author: Amy F.

description:
Not bad for a fast food sushi.
Expected old fish and fish was actually fairly fresh... Portions a bit small.  But you get what you pay for.
Couldn't taste the fish either as rice overpowered the small single fish in hand roll.

Hand roll seaweed was also soft and lacked contrast of a pop as expects from a bite into roasted seaweed.  Contrasting the crunch of seaweed and rice was also missing.

Happy hour 3-6 has a lot of good offers as their California roll was only $3.

If I spend time on the throne I will update and downgrade accordingly.
author: David H.

description:
Tip:  You have to walk all the way inside to order before getting your number and finding a table to sit down.  

You certainly get what you pay for here.  I got the double punch and heaven rolls and an Inari nigiri.  Not bad at all!  I even saved some for a later snack ;) Both rolls have a little kick to it but nothing extreme!

My friend got the chicken katsu and initially we thought that he wouldn't be able to finish the dish but our prediction was wrong!  All in all, not bad for lunch and we might be back since it's one of the few Japanese places around.
author: Christy Y.

description:
Tokyo Express is my comfort food and where my lunch comes from at least twice a week. When work days are busy, I go to OrderAhead online and pick out my favorite Tokyo Express dishes. The restaurant could not be much closer to my office and I place my pickup order, go see the friendly faces at Tokyo Express, and am back at my desk with my delicious lunch in under 5 minutes. Did I mention that I usually spend less than $9 for more food than I can eat in one meal? :) A few of my favorites are:

- Vegetable udon soup (substitute soba noodles) meal which comes with a salad
- Salmon teriyaki meal, comes with rice, salad, and miso soup
- Tempura udon soup (substitute soba noodles), the tempura dipping sauce is SO good and the tempura is served in a separate container so it doesn't get soggy

They also have happy hour from 3:30 to 5:30 pm that includes edamame for about $2, seaweed salad for around $3, cheap hand rolls, and more!

I think I might be Tokyo Express's most frequent customer but I'm okay with that! I'm proud to say that I've gotten a lot of my colleagues hooked too and most of the employees now know my name!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Fast food sushi. Normally something to be scared of, but this place is great. The sushi is reasonably priced for San Francisco, which is why it has four stars. I think if I was a sushi snob, maybe I'd give it three, but I personally enjoy the sushi here a lot and I feel the prices are very reasonable. Not to mention, it's order at the counter, so no additional cost for tipping. 

I've a lot of menu items, from special sushi rolls to udon (noodles), and rice dishes. They've all been solidly good. I'm there's no ramen, but I get that that's a special thing to prepare. 

The bathrooms are decent.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
Not the best, most authentic sushi I've had but it's still good! I've been hooked on this place since my coworkers told me about it. It's very affordable and the daily specials are awesome! Especially on Wednesdays when they have the caterpillar roll and the cali crunch roll for $9.99. YUMMM.

Staff is very nice and they are quick!
author: Tiffany P.

description: Food quality and price was absolutely great. We got the food quickly even though there were quite a lot of people. The decoration was less cosy and fast-foodish and the restrooms less well maintained.
author: Liisa H.

description:
This place hasn't changed in years, its always been a) fast b) good c) reasonably priced.
You order at the counter, they give you a number, you get your food quickly.
In 2015 $4 for a good Tekka Maki near Moscone is unbeatable.
You can also usually get free Kimchi at the front and they always have free Barley Tea.
I know its fast food, but you can order reasonably fancy stuff there without breaking the bank.
Chirashi (my default order at any Japanese place) is very reasonable and plentiful.
author: Tom S.

description:
Pros

Fast food 
Inexpensive
Good selection
Tempura
Free tea
Order upfront , they bring food to you
Don't feel compelled to tip or tip small amount
Ample seating
Clean

Cons

Beef teriyaki, cheap beef- don't recommend
Average quantity or less
Quality fair 

Have repeated.   Quick food that's decent and inexpensive.
author: John L.

description:
I was walking in the area, craving for sushi and decided to give this place a chance.

I was not expecting much since it's a fast food sushi but turns out the place was a nice surprise. I ordered sushi combo 4: rainbow sushi, spice tuna rolls, salad and mizushiro. The sushi was delicious, fresh and nicely prepared. Affordable price plus no need to tip: make things even better!
author: Bruna P.

description:
OK. It was almost blind luck that I stayed and ate at this restaurant. When I went to the menu at the counter, the lady there told me that they were closed except for take out. They were perhaps 20 or so customers eating dinner around me, and I couldn't understand what she meant by that.

I was about to leave, but I was really hungry for sushi and decided to get my order to take out. As I was figuring out what I was going to get the lady asked me if I wanted to eat in. I thought she said that it was take out only, but she said something that I can understand. Hunger took over, and I ordered.

First of all, let me say this restaurant really smells bad, like maybe it hasn't been cleaned all day. There were a lot of tables that hadn't been bussed, and that kind of detracts from the ambience.

The sushi was not all that good, but consistent with foodcourt quality. I had to go and ask for wasabi and ginger, and there were no usual dishes available until I dug around for them. The miso soup was a bit tepid, made from some sort of mix.

So, that's all that tasty, and certainly not very fancy, but reasonable price and good in a pinch.
author: Jon C.

description:
The Japanese food here isn't the best of quality but it is cheap, satisfying, and filling. The portions are quite generous as well and the location is quite convenient. The happy hour specials are quite good as well.

The menu is massive and there are heaps of things to choose from. This is also a great place for take aways. I enjoyed this place so much that I practically ate there everyday and got sick of it and burnt out. But anyway I highly recommend this if you are after something not to pricey and quite casual. Great for Lunch or afternoon tea.
author: Julian I.

description:
My fave place for seafood udon..  Nothing fancy and it's simple but not too plain.  Prices are great and the happy hour menu is def worth taking advantage of!

Sad I don't work downtown so I can't come here as often!
author: Vanessa T.

description: The service was fast and friendly. This is not a traditional restaurant style. Would recommend for quick and casual meals. Very good food and portions.
author: DiAngelo S.

description: For a quick bite this fits the bill. $10 for Salmon Donburi including small salad and soup. Free kimchi and water. Nothing fancy but decent food. Beats Denny's next door.
author: Russ C.

description: 3.5 star is an accrute rate. One less star for not redeeming my $5 off, charging me a dinner size instead of a appetizer lemon basil chicken, and for charging me an extta beer, all on only 2 occasions. Lately they have been sloppy since the change in the managers. Otherwise a good spot for some beers and tasty Asian food. We come here often.
author: Duke B.

description:
Basically this is fast food sushi but with a rather extensive menu. Quality is not the best but if you want something quick and get a decent bang for your buck, this is the place. You can order online to by pass the line. They get rather busy during lunch time. A lot of rolls and bowl dishes. I got the 12 piece sashimi and its about 3 different types of fish - salmon, tuna, and white tuna. Nothing fancy but it does come with soup and salad. They also have free kimchee as well. 

osmething quick - this is the place to go
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Good, inexpensive, fast sushi/maki. Lots of options too. The place is always packed, so you know the fish is fresh. Plus, they have beer and wine! Sushi just doesn't taste as good as it does when washed down with a cold beer!
author: Ryan S.

description: I came here a few times and this time one of the rolls was bad -the Philadelphia roll. Both salmon and cream cheese was not good. The salmon was not soft at all and tasted so fishy. The quality was very poor and so was the cream cheese. The California roll was fine.
author: Carmen L.

description:
I think this is one of the most underrated sushi joints in SF. The price is dirt cheap, however the fish has been super fresh the dozen or more times I have eaten there. I highly recommend the salmon sashimi dinner! I have tried most of the sashimi they serve and the salmon has always been a standout. The happy hour from 3-6 is also a killer deal! 
Note* Order at the counter and seat yourself. This is not a fancy place, but it is still very welcoming with a warm and cozy atmosphere.
author: Nelly M.

description:
I felt torn about writing this review as this is one of my go-to places for lunch, but not anymore. I woke up on Friday morning feeling a bit nauseous. I've only had food poisoning once, in my entire life, and I definitely felt stomach cramps and frequently going to the restroom. While everyone around me is sneezing and coughing, I'm usually good about not getting sick. But a 73 out of 100 score according to San Francisco's Department of Health rating of the restaurant is despicable especially if you handle raw food like sushi, which happened to be one of their lunch specials on that Thursday. That score in academia is approaching barely passing. This restaurant should've at least displayed their latest rating in a conspicuous place. I'll avoiding eating here from now on.

http://goo.gl/MA1PM (I had to use a URL "shortener" to get the restaurant score link to display properly)
author: Gerard Y.

description: I absolutely LOVE their happy hours. $3 for 8 pieces of california roll!! YUM! happy hour is also every single day! I also really love the open space inside and it make you feel really comfortable
author: Angela L.

description:
Oh tokyo express, I love your staff and I used to love your food. But alas that has come to an end.

I'll probably be back because you're so convenient but due to the price raise it just doesn't make a lot of sense. $8.70 for a roll and edamame, should be cheaper considering the high end places are $10 and superior quality.

Again, staff here rock but due to one really really terrible sushi experience with the 3rd worst scraps of salmon I've ever had (the two worst I designate to 2 times I was food poisoned, not bad for sushi 4x a week for years.)

I don't know who made it but oh my even my vegan friend can cut fish better. 

Thank you Tokyo express, I loved you in 2013. 3/5 because they have salt on the table for edamame and the staff. They even fed me NYE.
author: Alice ..

description:
This is sort of like MdDonald's meets Safeway Sushi. 

Tokyo Express benefits from a good location, on busy Mission between 4th and 5th, across from the large SF City lot at 5th and Mission, near the Moscone Convention center, near the Marriott, a block form the Westfield Mall, etc. There are tons of other choices for food within 2 blocks of here, but not much in Japanese choices, unless you include the Vietnamese Pho place across the street (Green Papaya) that pushes sushi too, with a corner sidewalk sign and LED lights flashing "Sushi". 

There is no sushi bar, sushi chef, or real sushi here. So don't come here expecting , well, er... Sushi!  If you like Yada Yada Whateva Rolls, which is anything slightly familiar to a Californian, be it avocado, Mexican spices, Jack-in-the-box secret sauce, Thousand Island dressing, mayonnaise, all with a little rice ball, etc. you might be ok. 

Which reminds me of my parents. My Dad was Swedish descent, and liked butter and soy sauce combined in his rice bowl, for flavor, to make it edible. He was ahead of his time in the Yada Yada Whateva roll design contest! My mother, being Japanese, raised in a sushi restaurant business, would abhor the sight of this abomination of a Japanese staple. It would be like putting Wasabi and Ginger in your home made Mash potatoes. Wait! I think we have something here!  The makings of a new Yada Yada Whateva roll! The Idaho Roll! A double Carb delight! 
Put some butter AND soy sauce on that puppy! 

Which brings me back here. Like I said, this is like Burger King meets Japanese diner. Except all the people working here are any Asian ethnicity except Japanese: perhaps Malay, Indonesian, Chinese, not sure what. And in the kitchen, like in 50% of all restaurant kitchens, the cook staff could do Mariachi gigs on the weekends. 

Nothing against this ethnic variety, in fact I like ethnic variety, but not so much with a particular ethnic food that none of these ethnicities were raised on. it just is what it is. 

I think someone should open a Mexican Fusion restaurant, instead of an Asian fusion restaurant with Mexican flavors, don't you? How about Mexican Fusion with French, instead of Asian Fusion with French? I mean that has been done a thousand times. How come only the Off the Grid food trucks combine other cuisines into tacos and burritos? Time to upscale Mexican food in creative ways. Start with Mole sauce. 

They actually have a pretty broad menu of Japanese diner like foods, such as Donburi, Udon noodles, etc. You order from the menu on the wall above the counter, pay, and get a number tag to put on your table for someone to bring out to you your order. Or you just order to go, which adds a lot of volume at lunch time I am sure. 

Most of the people who actually sit down and eat in here are foreign tourists, Aussies, Brits, a host of other countries, and the American out of towner. They are staying at a nearby hotel and want something cheaper, after paying $30 for breakfast in their hotel. So they come here, because they don't know about Yelp yet, or don't have enough Cab Fare. (Actually, there is a dearth of good Japanese restaurants in San Francisco, sad face.)

If you are a local, you come here out of convenience, to get a representative sampling of Japanese flavors, prepared by Latinos, and served by Southeast Asians. 

Well they're Asians working here, right? So this must be good sushi! 

Uso! 
(Not!)
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Really just a place to get a quick lunch while you're on your lunch break...


I've had their dragon roll and it was really just sub par
The prices are also on the high side for food that's not really that great, but it's not BAD. 

So for a quick lunch, just like its name suggest, Tokyo Express fits the bill.
author: Sean S.

description: IV just had the worst upset stomach of my life after visiting this place last week. Still sick. Please avoid this place.
author: Sam B.

description:
The sushi was ok. For about $15 I bought a Dynamite Roll (spicy tuna, eel, asparagus, lightly fried), a veggie tempura appetizer and canned soda. The veggie tempura was soggy and the tempura breading didn't hold it's crispiness too well. There was only 5 small pieces of veggies with the tempura order. The sushi had a crispy outside which was kind of nice  but the fish they used was not quite fresh. Despite that shortcoming, the roll still tasted decent. They also give you small dishes of kimchee for free. I didn't try it because I don't eat kimchee. 

My friend liked her soft shell crab hand roll and she said her maguro sashimi tasted fresh. She said her parents regularly come here because the sushi is decent and reasonably priced. The service is simple and has a fast food feel to it.  You order at the counter and then someone brings out your order.  You have to go back to the counter if you need anything extra (wasabe, ginger).

I think it's a cool spot to grab a quick bite especially on a hectic day of shopping. It's also great if you want to eat something light before a movie since it's really close to two movie theaters.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: This place can get pretty busy during lunchtime, so that should tell you how popular it is.  Food is good for fast food.  They offer a broad variety of menu items and service is pretty good.  I prefer the bento boxes since I don't want to spend time reviewing the menu.  I also think their prices are comparable.
author: Lon H.

description: Super Great Food and Nice Portions! I went here with my Daughter and we had a wonderful time! Highly Recommend!
author: Jim W.

description:
So I'm walking down the street in SF, super bummed that the Metreon is closed for construction; so whats a girl to do? Get sushi, of course!  Fortunately I stumbled upon Tokyo Express! I was super shocked to find an inexpensive sushi joint in this area and was stoked beyond belief when I yelped it and saw the stellar reviews.  

Free hot and iced tea as well? Damn, i'm sold.  

Ordered avocado rolls as usual and a giant steaming bowl of veggie udon, which came out to about $10. Nice.  Everything was tasty and legit and the restaurant was clean and orderly.   Although its fast food style dining the food is good and the price is right. My parents even wanted to come back later (after we spent a bit too much shopping in union square) and they enjoyed it as well.  

Seriously where else can 3 people have dinner for under $30 in this part of SF?? Probably not many places where you're not just stuffing yourself with nasty burgers and fries.  Healthy, cheap Japanese food all the way, yo.  Check it out sometime!
author: Rebecca S.

description: Japanese Fast Food day...today special is Tonkatsu with California roll under $10 in SF  downtown! 4 stars for the value
author: tuan t.

description:
This place is great - but you need to understand what it is. It's cheap sushi. If you don't feel right paying $20 for a 6-piece roll, no matter how pretty it looks, then you should come here.

Great udon bowl, lots of flavor and ingredients (shrimp tempura, egg, tofu, chicken, crab, bay shrimp, spinach, seaweed). Tempura was mediocre - but considering that it was 1.50 with an entree purchase, that was worth it. 
Sushi was great too. A little lopsided, but I didn't care. 

Overall great place to fulfill your sushi craving on a weekday. Wouldn't recommend it as a first date place (though perhaps it would be a good idea to take a first date here just to filter out the divas).
author: Diane W.

description:
If you're into having the the type of cuisine you can only get at a suburban mall out in (- name your podunk town -) or at the airport next to the Boudin clam chowder bread bowl, then Tokyo-Express will be right up your alley. It's in that ruffian-dominated Bermuda Triangle at Mission and 4th anchored by Denny's and Mel's. In fact, this was the former Jack-in-the-Box space, and it still has that makeshift fast-food atmosphere that makes me draw fast conclusions about the place. 

The food here is neither offensive nor memorable, which is what they may be aiming for in the kitchen since the target customer base appears to be teen-aged Asian boys on their smartphones. I'm assuming none of them could get dates since it wasn't a school night when I ventured in here. I ordered predictably, the $6.59 Chicken Teriyaki Bento with Vegetable Tempura. The serving is plentiful, for sure. 

The tempura was good, but the chicken had that unmistakably plastic sheen that make you wonder how much polyethylene was in the sauce. Yes, it came with the little bowl of miso soup and a little salad bowl with a strangely grainy miso dressing. No, it's not Nobu. It's Tokyo-Express, the same name used during WWII to describe how the Japanese transported supplies to Guadalcanal at night. That has nothing to do with this place, but isn't that interesting? 

FOOD - 3 stars... Japanese food to make you think you're at the airport...oh no, did I forget my passport? 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...shopping mall food court 
SERVICE - 4 stars...I have to admit they are quite attentive here 
TOTAL - 3 stars...what did I eat again?
author: Ed U.

description: Good food, great price. I had the salmon teriyaki with tempura, and the Salmon was a Daily Special. The food was tasty, and great as a mid range option to eat. Not too cheap but not super classy. The dining area has a non intimidating aesthetic that my friend and I liked. My friend did not like her sushi, but loved her plate. Waiter almost didn't serve me my soup and salad, but besides that service was good and fast.
author: Lizzie C.

description: Was shamed for foreign credit card, Uber came and got me to take me modern Japanese restaurant.. Maybe food good but shitty till software. No excuses
author: Chris B.

description: I must have walked by this place 50 times in the last year and I finally gave it a try.  What works is that it is decent Japanese food - all the menu items are there; udon, chicken katsu, teriyaki, and more. Also there is sushi and it is surprisingly good.  It's not the freshest stuff but it's tasty and filling.  I had a special roll with avocado and spicy tuna and it was under $10, which is a good find in expen$$ive SF.  I am adding a star because the service was awesome - the people who work there are super friendly and helpful.  It's a good spot to grab a bite in the chaos of downtown SF and it won't drain your wallet.
author: David Z.

description:
What does a 30-minute lunch break get you?

5 minutes to speedwalk over here.

10 minutes to order then receive your food.

5 minutes to walk back to work.

10 or less minutes to wolf down the bento.

What does the next 30 minutes get you?

Hungry again.
author: Dan B.

description: Very convenient, especially when the lines at the Metreon eateries are too long.  I usually get the udon, which is very decent!  There is free kimchee, water, and tea.  Can't beat the convenience.
author: Miran C.

description:
The concept is great: fast-food sushi! Ideal for busy SF lunchers, you can either take away or sit in their McDonalds-y dining room. Despite the speedy service, all the sushi appears to be made-to-order, not pre-packaged which of course makes it all feel a bit safer.

My experiences have been mixed. The key is reading the menu carefully and making sure you're getting exactly the type of roll you want. This seems obvious, but it can be so fast-paced in here during lunchtime that I often feel rushed into ordering and end up with something weird like a mango-crab roll. Now I know to take my time viewing the photo menu on the wall and surveying the daily lunch combo deals listed right in front of the register (usually 2 rolls & a soup/salad for under $10). They also have free house tea, with unlimited refills. 

Recently, I ordered a big jug of miso soup to-go for about $4, which was probably the most satisfying item I've walked away with here. But, I haven't lost hope! A quick sushi fix is something to cherish, and I'm happy to have Tokyo Express around to do the job safely and cheaply.
author: Nique F.

description:
I CHANGED MY MIND OKAY? 

This place deserves four stars; like many other establishments, because they had me at salmon sashimi. 

I was here again for lunch, minding my own business, waiting for my order at my table. I ordered the salmon sashimi which was going against my previous O-K sashimi combo experience. Darn me to heck, the salmon sashimi was surprisingly lovely. Buttery, fresh, lusciously thick cut pieces on a bed of ice and radish bits. Mind you, I am not just updating my review because my raw salmon pieces were especially good. Since my first 3-star experience I have probably returned twice. I noticed that despite the crazy rush, my rolls were satisfying with plenty of ingredients, well put together (do not fall apart mid-chopstick), and nicely arranged on the plate. (I appreciate sushi-arrangements). 

I realized that they offer a wide range of interesting rolls (I forget what it was called....The Killer maybe? But today I had a delicious roll with salmon, tuna, spicy tuna and seaweed salad and it was super yummo and well-made). Not only are their rolls varied and delicious, but I find that they are well put together, made with fresh ingredients, and always come with an ample helping of ginger. 

During the lunch rush, expect a small delay, but also understand that there are probably 40 lanyard-people fresh outta Moscone meandering into Tokyo Express clogging up the works. Cut some slack, jack....your miso is coming. 

In terms of sushi-shaped lunch fixes, Tokyo Express is what you want as a busy, sushi-craving SOMA employee. It's quick, comfortable, healthy, and sushi. 

Sushi? Yes please. I'll be back, have an extra star because sushi.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
It was good and the food was super delicious I ordered sweet potato fries, basil chicken and wings and Cali rolls with their delicious calamari and all in the happy hour so cheap and great food 
Very recommended
author: Mustafa A.

description:
I happened to be in the area recently for a small group of out of towners.  After walking countless miles, ducking into countless shops, and in general having a really great time, we found our stomachs looking for nourishment!

It just so happens that we were passing right in front of this place when the subject of lunch arose.  Sushi!  I have no problem with that at all.  We all went inside for some tasty Japanese fare.

The place is medium sized - you walk up to the counter and place your order/pay.  The cashier gives you a numbered card that you stick onto the metal base thing on the table you choose.  I ordered the Sushi B combo - a selectioin of nigiri and a california roll.  It's also served with a small salad (premade) and a small bowl of miso soup.  

The sushi was tasty, and well worth the asking price ($9).  Fresh slices of salmon, tuna, prawn, and BBQ eel on rice.  Not too big, but not too small either. The california roll was a bit heavy with the mayo sauce - but other than that I found my meal to be of good quality.

At the counter, they have a few beverages that are self serve - hot and iced tea, as well as water.  Keep this in mind before buying a $2 bottle of smart water.  

4 outta 5 stars from me - I will be back if I'm in the neighborhood and in need of a reasonably priced, fast Japanese meal.
author: Gibson T.

description: Worst wait ever. Ordered one roll and have been waiting for about 35 minutes. The first time they brought it out it was cold, even though it was suppose to have oven baked salmon. About 6 more customers have came in the last 30 minutes and all of them have received their food. I'm just sitting here waiting, debating or if I should even wait since the seaweed in the soup was harder than I rock... .
author: Linda D.

description: This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in downtown SF. Affordable and tasty foods. I recommend trying chicken katsu and soft shell crab
author: Den F.

description: I've gotten the sushi combo #3 and at $11 it's one of the cheaper comboes on the menu. The food here is decent but definitely on the pricey side. I'm generally unimpressed with the express side of express but I feel like it is the only Japanese cuisine in the area.
author: Alfonso C.

description:
I used to come here during my student days when I was craving Japanese food because it was cheap!  

Came back last week and the food went downhill. Awful quality. Hopefully, they'll get back to their feet again.
author: Leslie M.

description:
This is officially the place I go to punish myself.

I ordered salmon teriyaki "entree," and got chicken instead. White rice was under cooked and crunchy, chicken tasted fowl (get it? ) but in all seriousness,  oddly gamey despite being drowned in sticky sweet teriyaki sauce. 

The tempura was soggy,  sad,  and actually interesting.  A very philosophical pondering arises "how be deep fried food be THIS bad? "
author: Sue Y.

description: I was craving some sushi but didn't want to spend a ton of money, so we found this place on yelp. The location of the restaurant was good, a relatively short walk from Powell Station/Union Square. The atmosphere was casual, but nicer than fast food. I ordered the soft shell crab appetizer and the chirashi, both were quite good. The quality of the food wasn't amazing or anything, but nice for the price! I thought the soft shell crab had a bit too much breading, but the crab tasted fresh and flavorful so I didn't mind. The chirashi came with a good variety of fish, massago, seaweed salad, miso soup, and a light side salad. It had everything and just what I wanted. The restaurant even offers free water, iced/hot tea, and kimchi. What a great deal!  I enjoyed my meal here. This will be my new go-to food place for future Union Square shopping trips!
author: Sarah W.

description:
i finally found a place that can make my sushi without rice!!!
they are super friendly, clean, and efficient.

they deserve ten stars!
author: M D.

description:
The crunchy California Roll was so good! And you can't beat $5.50!
