Warning: The mint & plum sushi tastes wicked bad.
author: Andrea R.

description: Found an orange peel inside of my beef udon.. Also there was red lettuce inside of my salad?
author: Lashondraneesha W.

description: Not the freshest fish, however it hits the spot if you are craving sushi in the FiDi. About $14 will get you 3 rolls. The California Roll and Alaska Roll are my favs.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I came in with the expectation that the food would be cheap and palatable. So I left pretty happy! Came in around noon, got in and out quickly with two rolls at $10 total. Great deal for this area.

I had the tofu crunch roll with cucumbers and ginger: A+ would eat again. Very bright and tasty, nice fry on the tofu.

On the other hand, there was a bone in my hamachi and scallion roll, so that pretty much sums up that. 

Recommend the vegetarian rolls for sure. I likely won't get fish here again. Maybe I'll try the teriyaki next time. Great place for a less exp, fast lunch in SoMa.
author: Christine T.

description:
This place is totally different than any sushi joints I've been to. Let me put this out there, I have been to multiple sushi places, and sushi is my favorite type of food.

So I came up to San Francisco for a job interview, but before my cousins wanted to grab some lunch with me prior to the interview.They suggested to go to Tokyo Express.

I've never been to a sushi joint where I had to go up to the counter and order, except at the mall. Haha. Kinda different but definitely not a problem. I ordered 2 rolls, totally forgot what they were called but I will post up a photo of it. From there on, they give you a number and you are to choose any table you want. Servers bring out your food from which table you are sitting at.

Food came out, sushi tasted mediocre. I've tried better. It wasn't disappointing, but it was also not mouth watering. Supposedly. it was my lucky day being in the city, because it was one of their hottest days. Down side of that beautiful day I was eating in this restaurant, they do not have air condition. Totally not my lucky day, I was wearing slacks, a blouse, as well as a blazer, SWEATING BULLETS.

3 stars for mediocre sushi. I may change my mind once I start working in the city. -2 stars for no air condition. (haha)
author: Quyenna T.

description:
Just discovered this place on my way to the mall. I was skeptic at first about how fresh the ingredients would be or if it would taste like mall food. The verdict= EXCELLENT!

The prices are reasonable for things such as bento's, sushi rolls over rice dishes. The hubby and  I had the chicken teriyaki, which was actually grilled nicely and it was a heaping portion. I had the katsu don-this wasn't my favorite version of it as they didn't cover the cutlet with runny egg and there were no sautéed onion in it, just some random veggies and a fried egg on top. We decided to also split a sushi roll-forgot the name but it was basically a spicy tuna poki with seaweed salad on top. The tuna did taste fresh and overall the food was good, especially the chicken teriyaki.

I definitely recommend eating here if you're in the area as as opposed to paying for the expensive food court!

Tip: Hot tea and ice water are included with your meal!
author: Petra S.

description:
The Sushi combos also give you the right to some free beverages (if you're eating here).

There's also a salad and a Miso soup.

It's a ok deal but I had better sushi. Maybe it was the day...
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Take-out review
I order my lunch from here about once a week, always tastes fresh and fish is never cold. Good service, expected quality for price.
author: David P.

description:
We were in SF for a conference, and were looking for a lunch that all 4 of us could agree on. Sushi it was! 

I yelped somewhere in the area, and we came up with Tokyo Express. 

The interior is very cute, modern, bright, and fun. The menu is HUGE, so it took a while to find something, but all of us enjoyed our meal and it wasn't that expensive.

I'd go back!
author: Danielle S.

description: This place is good for the price. Eaten here and ordered delivery, both times sushi has been good and well priced. Really like the many veggie roll options.
author: Ari H.

description:
Sited between Metreon (Target) and Westfiled mall both physically and in the social sphere. Not a joint for the Japanophile epicurean's who fawn over a plate of  Ootoro sashimi or Uni Ika Sugomori Zukuri. 

Key things to expect when eating at Tokyo-Express:

1. Serve your own tea (hot or chilled) - complementary
2. Kimchi - complementary
3. You are not in Tokyo, it is just part of their name (don't expect the service, food, ambiance or price to be the same...as Tokyo)
4. Samsung flat-screens playing KPOP music vids 
5. Diner Pricing 
6. Food is served FAST ( the Express part of the name)
7. Wide variety (read diverse) set of clientele
8. Japanese fast food diner

A good joint to consider when near the Metreon or Westfield, and you are feeling cheap.  Far more popular than the near by Denny's (based on an informal, non-accurate walk by assessment). Not as good as http://www.sanraku.com/ in the Metreon mall, but at 1/2 the price.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Worst sushi and expensive with Food poisoning. The fish was not fresh. The miso soup was ok. The service was good but the fish was horrible and expensive for the poor quality.
author: Cheval M.

description:
The sushi is ok, not like OMG sushi, but man the owner passed around this guac nacho sushi thing..it's hecka good..i couldn't order it because it was new on the menu, but he gave me two extra for free. 

this place got free complementary kimchi and free hot tea..which is nice..it's really more or less a quick sushi to go/express place.

you get soup, salad, tea, kimchi and your choice of whatever for about $9..which isn't too bad and you get pretty full off of it. 

If you want something quick and easy, stop by here. I do know they will be changing their menu soon, so hopefully something good?
author: Minerva L.

description:
Only 1 start because this Asian chubby girl made me very up sad. 
This is not our first time coming here. Today (10-4-14: Saturday) we went to pick up food to eat at home as usual. Around 7pm at the restaurant this chubby Asian girl got our order and I asked her what was this points about (something that was in the counter). And she didn't even explain what exactly was (she was talking to another employee in other language, not Korean nor Cantonese or Chinese) I thought She was being very rude. It was not a happy service for us~
author: Kim K.

description: For delivery, this place get it done for Japanese food. Given the quality factor, delivering Japanese food is like delivering a fragile package and needs extra care and attention. They do a great job packing hot separate from cold which helps maintain the freshness of the fish. They work fast too so you don't wait forever. Not the greatest Japanese you can find but a better than average delivery option, no doubt.
author: Ed L.

description:
WARNING!
Worst service ever! Don't come here! Disrespectful crew service! I've been here for few times.. This lady embarassed me.. what a shame! I will never ever come here ever again!
author: Josephine L.

description:
Came here with some coworkers on a chill Friday afternoon. This is the fastest Japanese place I've ever been to. Finally, a place with "Express" in its name that is actually speedy! They have super hot tea and cold water on the side for you to grab - as a precaution, they do use those awesome tea mugs that make sure your fingers aren't burnt, but the liquid inside is boiling hot. Do yourself a favor and wait a couple of minutes before drinking some of that tea, or you won't be tasting your food for a while.

Chicken teriyaki combo was an excellent deal. For just $8 you get a big ol' plate of yummy food that comes with soup and salad. I really wanted a roll, but there were so many to choose from and the line was starting to form so I freaked out and just got the first thing I saw. I would definitely come back to try the rolls, and next time in the Metreon area with my family, I might try and convince them to come here with me instead of waiting around at Mel's. Man, I do love me some cheap, good, and quick Japanese food.
author: Robbin A.

description: This place is about HAPPY HOUR!! It is such a great value 3 pm - 6pm and you must try the Lemon Basil Chicken, soooo goood.  Is this fine dining, HELL NO.  It is in a old Burger King and don't even look at how dirty the floor is.... The sushi will not be the best you ever had, well maybe the California Rolls.... but it will totally cure your sushi cravings. $5 for about 5 pieces of Sashimi and $3 for a full plate of chicken.....man listen this is it!! You may skip the Edamame here and tell me thank you, not worth it unless you add your own seasoning. Try the Calamari Rings $3!!! I'm just a fan of this place during happy hour, other than that there are better places in the city but the regular prices are not that bad either.
author: Kerah W.

description: Think fast and suitable for your sushi cravings. It's not the best, I mean they whip it out in no time and it's enough to get you full. I wouldn't order the fried crab again. It was more batter than anything. Their lemon basil chicken is definitely yumms.
author: Sharon B.

description:
I hardly knew this place existed until it came up on my Yelp app... it's tucked into a small, dark storefront on Mission (between the bus stop and the Denny's), so I hadn't really ever looked for anything good there before.

The choices are legion, and I'm not sure all of the options originated in Tokyo (or anywhere nearby), but it's a cheap, filling place for Japanese and other pan-Asian food. 

I had the 12-piece sushi lunch, which came with one California roll (not terribly appetizing: crab blended with mayo?) and some nigiri (Tuna, Salmon, etc.). The nigiri was okay, but that's about it. Not sure I'll be back, but if I do, I'll probably go for some noodles or a rice bowl.
author: Andrew M.

description:
It is quick and the price is very reasonable. 

It is not a full service dinner.  Basically you just order the food at the cashier and get a number.  Then the waitress will bring the food to you by seeing your number.

I would not expect good service as it is like a fast food restaurant.  However the waitress was polite during several times I ate here.  I would go again when I want some simple and fast Japanese food.
author: Jon W.

description: Food is medicore and service is slow. I thought this place was Tokyo Express. Should be Tokyo Slow.
author: Jeremy F.

description:
Great spot for cheap, good quality sushi! This place gets very busy during lunch hours, but the service is great. My co-workers and I always come here when we are craving sushi, which means we're here once or twice a week.

I'm a fan of the daily/weekly sushi specials/combos. You can get 10-12 pieces of sushi for about ten bucks. Specials come with side salad, miso soup, kimchee, and hot tea! Great deal. I've also tried several rolls on the menu and I was pretty happy with all of them. Lots of seating -- great place for groups.
author: Linda T.

description: delicious fresh food good service ! wish the ordering is faster and the place bigger !
author: Inigo C.

description:
Oh Tokyo Express, I used to be such a huge fan and thought of you as a hidden gem when I first stumbled into your doors. My recent visit here has made me realize that you unfortunately have fallen into the depths of mediocrity.

First off, the primary draw of this place was its inexpensive pricing with decent food. Especially around the touristy area that is Union Square, cheap and yummy food is hard to come by. As a result, I was sad to see that the prices have increased and the portions seem to have also shrunk. It's hard for me to justify paying $10+ for what can be considered a quick snack at best. There weren't any issues with the quality of the sushi, but the overall portion size was far too small. 

I'm not sure if I never noticed this before or if the situation has declined, but I recently found the interior to be very dingy. The lights are very dim which makes the restaurant seem a lot dirtier than it probably is. While there, I kept feeling like the restaurant wasn't very well kept. As a huge germaphobe, the especially dim atmosphere made me want to get out of there asap.

I miss the old Tokyo Express that provided great value for their food and an enjoyable dining experience. With so many nearby restaurants with creative concepts and quality food, I'm not sure I'll be back.
author: Sunny H.

description: Decent, fast food. Their daily specials are good and I like the teriyaki salmon. The food is very predictable and that makes this ideal for a quick lunch.
author: Sadique A.

description: Just had some food here last night with a couple of friends. We all had the chicken teriyaki which was not too bad. We also ordered some sushi. 3/4 of us are now sick with what we think is food poisoning.
author: Edith R.

description: Halfway through lunch...we noticed the cashier go to the restroom and return back to the cash register...AND did NOT WASH his hands!!!  Lost my appetite!!!
author: LaShaunda J.

description:
- 1 Star because the prices have gone a little up but I understand that the economy for everything is going up. But this star is mainly for their sushi size -- Its literally a snack [tinier then regular sushi's] In my opinion since they've raised their prices they should atleast make bigger rolls. Don't you agree?

Anyways I usually come here for their Chicken Teriyaki Combo -- The price up'd a little but I don't mind it because they still give as much. :) As for the Salmon Teriyaki I believe its only like 2 thick but thin pieces and Beef Teriyaki's alright. 

I do recommend this spot though. I have to admit its one of my favorite lunch spots. 

Ohh and as for the waiters there -- I'd say sometimes they can be Clumsy and a tad bit rude where they would just slide your food to you and or just drop it down on the table instead of nicely placing it. Ive seen a couple time where one waiter spilled soup or sauce onto their customer and another time one of them just kinda threw our food on the table. I know they don't get much tips or get paid much but seriously? 

All in all its a okay spot to eat because of the price! :)
author: Jennifer B.

description: If you are looking for cheap and good sushi and Japanese fare head to Tokyo Express. They have good size portions. You get all this for less than 20 bucks. I got my lunch in less than 10 minutes. You order like a fast food restaurant and they bring the food to your table.
author: Chris T.

description: I've eaten here during my lunch and for what seems like a fast-food type restaurant it's actually really good.  Their service is quick and the items I've tried so far were delicious!
author: Z.C. V.

description:
This is a review for sushi only!! So, not a fan. As I was eating my spicy something or other roll, I began to smell something just not fresh and as that sliver of roll was being swallowed I got a taste of not the best sushi I had ever eaten. The sushi was falling apart, and again just didn't taste as fresh as other places where you go and sit down. Again, this may be thought of as "cheap" and it is but, you get what you pay for? I had a special roll involving eel and such and it was around $8 and in other places it would be probably $10-13 but, there it would have been sitting in a nice booth with water glasses and in my personal sushi opinion better sushi.

As I mentioned, this place is cheaper than its counter parts as well as in a fast food style manner. Go up to counter, order and take a number with you to your seat where runners deliver you your goods. Similar to a McDonalds eating area, the place is dingy and definitely not my favorite place or a memorable place to dine. The other items like the donburi and and the teriyakis were again "cheap" (but not as cheap as one would like in this setting) but, did look all together delicious.

Overall, my coworkers enjoyed their meals I however would take a pass and keep walking to the million other options in this hood for a quick, cheap and easy meal to satisfy that lunchtime hunger.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Next to the target and metreon. Cheap Japanese food that tastes very good. I usually get the beef teriyaki and tempura udon. For a fee, you can swap out the vegetable tempura for extra shrimp.
author: William C.

description: So the food is okay, but I seem to go here often, because it's cheap and convenient for me. I usually end up getting the donburi, because it's often a good deal.  I don't really like how they cook the donburi, especially because the egg is overcooked. But for some reason, I keep coming back for it, because I like their "donburi" sauce, which is really teriyaki suace. I also like the amount of vegetables they put in it. It's my quick cheap and easy fix when I'm craving Japanese. Definitely no where close to the best, but it does the trick.
author: April D.

description:
Had the katsudon. It is true that the food here is not truly Japanese (i.e. No Japanese person would call this a katsudon), but if you can get past that, it is a decent, clean and inexpensive meal. 

The people in the kitchen are not Japanese. One of them was actually watching the Mexican soccer league (I guess it was a slow Sunday). 

One big pro was that you get complimentary tea and water, plus all the tonkatsu sauce you want. 

The service is fast, so this would be a good place to have a bite on the run.
author: Jorge B.

description: A great option for a filling, and potentially healthy meal (depending on what you order). Fairly large portions.
author: Allen Z.

description:
There is always one schmuck in a party, isn't it? 
Who thinks he owns you. He was like a used car sales man kinda idiot. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1M4uEbLYyAM

Oh hell, I was in the hell house. He thinks he is sushi expert so he wanted to know, how smart and knowledge he is about sushi, to show off, or judge me. If I was alone, I did not mind to take the jackass out side to "take care", but, as I always do, having a "great" sushi conversation for few minutes. The conversation ended when I said, " Btw, I had a pretty good spider roll at Tokyo Express, you should go."

Xsshole.

But, why people still liking saying "Express" for a fast food restaurant. It must be a Chinese-thing isn't it? Chinese business attitude is American business attitude.
Go for it. Fake Japo Fast Chinese made "Express" "Quickly" Japo-like food.
But Why Tokyo? Is it Tokyo food? Hell No!

I really dislike this place! I feel like there are not a lot of affordable places to get sushi in that downtown shopping area, and not a lot of convenient ones. This one you can just get your order, and eat. 

Long story short, I hate the tekka maki (I usually get one cause I have something else), and the tempura roll were Mushy. As long as the fish is fresh, I don't mind coming here but I don't think it is. The rice was soggy. Even though I'm not looking for super high end or anything, just something that hits the spot, I'll pass for next time. Once is enough. I don't want to waste my money again.

Ed U. wrote correctly, "The food here is neither offensive nor memorable, which is what they may be aiming for in the kitchen since the target customer base appears to be teen-aged Asian boys on their smartphones."
author: Nobu K.

description:
Ever since they opened here day one! I've been coming here!
I love eating here mainly because its borderline fast food but the waiter or waitress serves your food. Their meals comes with salad and miso soup and adding a couple of dollars in and you get the full combo with California roll and tempura. (it only comes with 4 for California roll and 2 tempura shrimp or something else) 
Lots of seats available. This store used to be the jack in the box and during those times, it was ghetto inside. Cigarette butts and people hanging out inside without buying anything, now it has changed and they did a great job fixing the mess. Bathroom is clean.

I love their teriyaki beef, lemon basil Chicken and donkatsu. Those are what I usually get.
Complimentary tea, ice water or unsweetened ice tea for the beverages and complimentary kimchi too. Awesome
author: Wendy Z.

description: Ok.  This place gets better.   I love the Kaki fry.  I love Jonas...he always makes me feel welcome and valued as a custy.   Sugar is also great.  I don't know the other staff by name but almost all are fabulous to me.
author: allen C.

description:
Not a bad place to stop in for a quick sushi lunch. Priced right for what you get - lunch for 2 was just under $23 - and service was quick and friendly. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if I needed a quick lunch again in the area I'd stop in. 

#BeAwesome - chase
author: Chase S.

description:
Very good food and the service is pretty awesome they treat you well!
I'll be definitely coming here again ;)
author: David E.

description: I love that place! They serve great food for reasonable prices.It's a cute restaurant, clean and simple, nothing fancy.
author: Katarina J.

description:
I don't come here for the sushi or the party that happens outside it's doors every night with the people walking past. I don't come here because of the friendly staff (which they are! always greeting me and anyone that comes in with words I don't understand but appreciate).
I come here for the Lemon Basil Chicken. Sure it's sometimes swimming in the sauce. But for me, it hits the spot.
Comes with rice, salad and miso soup.
Water and tea are at the side of the front counter. 
The restroom are all the way in the back.
Look both ways when coming out of the place.
I like the seating, but the decorative branches need to go away.
author: Chris A.

description: I was happy to find this place outside the mall. Loved the complimentary tea, my meal was actually great - okay price for a nine piece sake sashimi dinner... Only wanted a six piece but you can't get combo dinner with that. We arrived about 30 minutes before closing- the cashier seemed like she was in a bad mood and not very friendly when answering my questions ... Not very friendly when she brought out food, otherwise i prob would have given this four stars. Bf liked his terriaki chicken combo and the free kimchi . I'd return with lower expectations of friendly service ;)
author: Coco J.

description:
Great, fast, inexpensive sushi (and other Japanese food) in SoMA.  I've never been to a fast food format sushi place, but they make it work.  Walk up, place your order, wait a minute or two, then take your tasty food as take-out, or eat in one of the many nice tables in the front of the restaurant.

Probably my favorite inexpensive sushi place in the neighborhood, and possibly my favorite in the area overall.
author: Ryan L.

description: I ordered the sushi. Yes it is a fast food concept, but it seemed to be their thing as the majority of their menu is sushi. I was horribly disappointed and will not be a repeat customer. From the reviews it does seem there are other "happy hour" dishes that people enjoy, but I only tried their sushi.
author: Caitlin A.

description:
This place is good for its price. The portions that they give is worth the money. We order the Deluxe Bento, it has beef, tempura and sushi for 10.99. Plus the taste of it isn't bad at all. It came with salad and miso soup. The place deserves 5 stars for just being a "what I thought it's a fast food place" exceeded my expectation. 

The sashimi's cut were fairly thick and the quality of the fish is not bad at all. Considering it was 15.99. 

This is not the place to get top notch Japanese food because it'll never be that cheap but it's a good satisfying place.
author: Hei Ming C.

description:
When I think of fast food, sushi doesn't come to mind. Tokyo Express is a great option for a quick meal and some good food. So, since I found this place my perception of fast food completely changed (for good). 

For the price, you wouldn't think you would be eating anything of quality, but I haven't been disappointed yet. Food is good, seafood is fresh.They menu offers a wide variety of sushi and Japanese dishes. Since you have to order at the cash register and you don't exactly interact with servers, it is hard to rate their service, however, so far so good. food comes out super quick.

Their happy hour is great, you can get a roll for as low as $3.00. I often eat from their daily combos (two rolls or sachimi and a roll). All combos come with miso soup and salad.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: This little Japanese place opened up where the Jack-in-the-box used to be and it flies under the radar like another run-of-the-mill cheap sushi place, but it actually is quite good. The prices aren't bad and the selection is good. I'm glad this place opened up, the lunch selection near the Moscone Convention Center was getting pretty dry. This place is definitely worth trying.
author: Peter K.

description:
Tokyo Express is my favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco because their food is excellent and their commitment to customers and the environment is second to none. 

Most sushi restaurants serve sushi-grade fish, but for 15 years Tokyo Express has only served USDC Grade-A fish. This certification goes beyond basic Food & Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, which exhibits Tokyo Express's commitment to safety, wholesomeness, economic integrity, and quality in the foods they serve.

The USDC Grade-A fish served at Tokyo Express are caught by individual handline and are killed using the "Ike Jime" method, which causes blood contained in the fish flesh to retract to the gut cavity and produces a better colored and flavored fillet. It is also a faster and more humane method of killing fish.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Always have to stop at this place when we are in SF.  

It's really about the value that your small money can get. The sushi are fresh, made-to-order, and tasty. What surprises us is, as a fast food chain, they are able to offer restaurant-quality food at unbeatable price.

One thing I do hope is that they can clean up the tables sooner, particularly during the busy hours.
author: Stacey C.

description: Ordered the spider roll. Disgusting. I don't recommend this place at all. I've NEVER had " shrimp tempura " like that & let me tell you I've eating all down California.
author: Ashley R.

description:
More like  3.5 stars

The sushi was OK. The place is pretty spacious with korean pop songs playing ( I actually listen to kpop so I like.) Just go up and order, pay, find a table, and they'll bring your food to you. 

I ordered the caterpillar roll special which comes with 4 tempura rolls, miso soup, and salad it was a pretty satisfying roll. 
I would come back next time before watching a movie at the metreon or century nearby. It's fast and convient!
author: Eileen Z.

description:
Ew what? How is this place rated so highly?  Came here for happy hour after a long day of black friday shopping.  Plenty of seats around which is awesome.

First thing, they have happy hour from 3pm-6pm but only a sign at the entrance.  When you get inside, there's NO mention of happy hour on the menus or on the walls.  Am I suppose to remember exactly what is on the happy hour menu from the front door?  I might've just missed it, but it was hard trying to figure out what was even on the menu - their wall just felt cluttered.

Their soy sauce plates and cups were ALL DIRTY. Wtf?  Random bread crumbs on the soy sauce cups, bits of vegetables inside the tea cups, one of the pair of disposable wooden chopsticks seemed to have mold on it? - it was seriously nasty.

I got the spider roll combo, which was pretty good actually, but the memories of dirty dishes persisted in my mind.  It has a nice location, and it's cheap for sushi.  The free cold/hot tea is a nice treat while you wait for your meal.  If only they could clean a little bit better...
author: Edmund Y.

description: Love this place! I've been in SF for four days now and have ate in different places, but none like Tokyo Express. This place is busy, fast, clean, and they have a great selection of items. They give you free tea. It's a must try.
author: Marilyn C.

description:
As you walk into the restaurant you won't be certain if you're suppose to order your food first or just sit and wait for service. There is a menu right when you walk in but as you go deeper into the restaurant where the cashier and waiters are there is a better menu that consists of pictures. What you do is order your food either for to go or for there, when it's to go you have chairs to sit on as you wait for your food whereas when you eat for there you have a number to place at your table and the waiters will give you your food. However, the service here is quick and all the sauces you need is right next to you on the table. 

The first roll me and my bf ordered was the devil's roll which has spicy salmon and avocado topped with mango. This was delicious because it was sweet and spicy at the same time and when you dip it with soy sauce it gives a kick of salty flavor along with it. Another roll that we ordered was flying kamikaze which has spicy tuna, tempura asparagus, and albacore tuna. I found this roll to be average but the least one we liked from the other roll because we felt like the tuna wasn't fresh and that it was out for awhile because it tasted pretty warm and sashimi warm isn't good, I will tell you that. 

I would only recommend this place cause its cheap and has fast service, so if you're around this area and crave for sushi you should stop by here and experience it.
author: Victoria G.

description:
Please Do Not believe the other reviews for this restaurant....I can't even call it a restaurant.. It's like a fast food stand one would find at their local mall. If I could give this place "0" I would. Let's be honest it was horrible..I can't really say that but  horrible is the best word I can come up with right now to describe this place. 
So I was vacationing in San Francisco and really wanted sushi. After reading a few reviews I decided to try it out. I'm just going to assume that all the people that gave this place a 2 star and up never had sushi in their lives and decide to start by trying out this place. Gas station sushi probably taste better than that shit. But if you are a real sushi love and enjoy quality.. Stay away from this place
author: Sophie J.

description:
Quality Japanese food, decent ambiance, at an affordable price! 

Let's just say I'll be back.
author: Audrey L.

description:
I've eaten here few times in the past.. Very easy to get your food on the table. I think there are good on the portion size and they gave me a lots of chicken in my plate.. I actually don't pay to much attention to details when the place I'm eating isn't expensive.. 
My problem was their California roll was absolutely salty.. I've never never in my life encounter this in San Francisco with an exception today at Tokyo Express..  I hate salty food in general"not good for you" ..  
The tempura I though it was pure good, even though I don't eat them on the regular bases, I can't  speak for the rest of you..
They basically  have this tinny BBQ sauce they spread over your meal.I found it to interesting but with a luck of flavor.. 
This place is like someone who look good in their clothes, but when they take their clothes off!!! you want to run, but u can't ..
author: Pedro D.

description: I kinda like this little place. Not exactly the notch Japanese restaurant, but it's nice location, complimentary green tea, and pretty good sushi quality. But they don't charge my arms and legs like those surrounding restaurant. So I think they deserve some appreciations. :-) You guys are great.
author: Clement H.

description:
What a great little find in the middle of San Fransisco. 

Although a very casual atmosphere, the quality and selection of the food is incredible. 

The service was friendly and made for a nice relief at the end of the day.

I tried the tempura shrimp with an added California Roll. Delicious and simple.

Maybe not the spot for a romantic date night, but the perfect spot for some good food with friends.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Jeff B.

description: Angel is the best sushi chef he makes the best tasting rolls he should be in a five star restaurant
author: Katherina H.

description:
Recommended by one the employees at the Metreon.

A lot fo different items on the menu.  Walk up to cashier and order.  They give you a number and bring you your foods.  Service was great!

I ordered Chicken Udon because its pouring rain. In June!  The Udon was very flavorful, I added a bit of soy sauce.  The noodles were great texture and the chicken was grilled.  There were pieces of tofu and some seaweed.  It was actually really good.  I also ordered crispy california rolls.  Too much mayo. Not gonna order it again.  

Very inexpensive.  A lot of people who work in the area and go to school next door eat here.  By the time we left it was packed!  Pretty good for a work lunch!!
author: Erika G.

description: Really convenient, fast, fresh, tasty, cheap sushi. Plentiful tea. California roll was great - check out the specials.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I had been here for couple times and the experiences were ok. (I would give it 3 stars) This time I felt so disappointed, so I dropped to the two stars.
I ordered the salmon don today , and the way it  was cooked isn't Japanese food at all!!! It just like salmon tariyaki with a fried egg on the top....... 
I understand some people may say the price here is much cheaper than other Japanese restaurant. However, I think customer deserve great food when they decided to walk in a Japanese restaurant and expect the higher quality of Japanese food! Anyway, just escape this one!
author: Chi Yi L.

description: Worst service. So disappointed. They spilt hot soup on me and my purse took them forever to bring a wet towel to assist in cleaning up and then when they came around to clean up the table they spilt the soup on my purse again. Very nonchalant and unconcerned. I won't be back ever. The tempura was stale and chewy.
author: Seth N Shawna S.

description: When you need a quick sushi fix and want your wallet to be happy as well, come here. Food is fair quality. Prices are unbeatable in Sf. I LOVE how you order at the counter , take a number to your choice of table and the waiters bring you your food. Their teriyaki is good. Tempura is fair, they use the correct breading/Panko but ONe time it was a bit on the soggy oily side. Never order the spider roll.Our table had about 1/8th of soy sauce in the bottle :(
author: Sergey P.

description:
Jessica T had been raving about Tokyo Express for days when I finally decided to go with her to see what all the good talk was about. And I have to say I can see why she likes it so much.

Housed in an old Jack-in-the-Box they kept the design inside the same, but changed the type of food you are ordering drastically. It kind of feels odd to step up and order sushi rolls or noodle bowls instead of cheeseburgers and weird tacos, but your tummy will be a-ok with it.

It's a really nice option for a quick lunch near my office that doesn't include salad or sandwiches and they give you complimentary green tea with lunch, which is just a little extra bit of nice that happens to go a long way with me.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I am vegetarian, which pretty much means I do not eat real sushi, so this review is not useful for you it you want real sushi. :P
I ordered a vegetarian sushi combo (15 pieces, meso soup and salad) and cruchy vegetarian sushi roll (6 pieces). The combo comes with Meso Soup and salad. I did not enjoy meso soup or salad. But they were edible. The sushis were tasty. I enjoyed them a lot. 
It is decently priced. In $14, I was more than full.
author: Rohit J.

description:
FASTFOOD - SUSHI
(3.5 stars)

How cheaply-convenient with location, price, and other things. Express was the correct word to place in the name of the restaurant. Felt like i walked thru a japanese restautant drive-thru, order, grab and go.

- food, decent. fair. but of course had better.
- prices, affordable
- service, fast
- ambiance, small

While waiting for a friend to get off of work, i had time to kill and dropped in to grab a very small simple bite. and that is exactly what was delivered.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

California Roll ($2.95) - typical california roll you find in the Financial District. imitation crab and the same stuff. But it was good and made ont he spot (in 1 minute) unlike all those others that are prepackaged and sitting out until its bought.

There were other items on the menu i'd like to try but was having a big dinner momentairly and needed to supress the hunger for something small.

Will I be back? perhaps.

Until the next review.
author: Jane A.

description: Good sushi on the cheap. Its good quality and they have a nice selection. Its fast for a short lunch but you can take your time to have an almost relaxing dinner if you find a table out of the main traffic areas. Sushi should be fish, vegetables and rice. Nothing fancy just good quality. So far this place is hitting all the right notes. They usually have a free Kimchi offering and tea at the front counter. I also like that they always have a special going on.
author: Ben M.

description:
I've been searching far and wide for a decent Japanese lunch spot near work. I look for variety when I think Japanese lunch, meaning, give me a bento w/ soup, salad, rice, meat and tempura!  

While most of the Japanese restaurants in downtown are "fast" food, Tokyo Express is a refreshing choice when I want a tasty bento box style lunch. I wouldn't exactly call it a sit-down OR fast food restaurant, but it's somehwere in between. You order up at the counter, take a number, help yourself to tea or water, find a table and wait for the servers to bring you the food.

I tried the Beef teriyaki bento box ($7.99)  w/ tempura (+ $1.15). This came with miso soup and salad. The soup was good and i really appreciated something free and warm on this cold, rainy day. The salad was good too, but the dressing was a bit watery.

I read on Yelp that this place is Korean owned, and i was a bit hesistant about ordering the Beef teriyaki because a lot of Korean owned Japanese restuarants serve bulgogi as "beef teriyaki." Luckily for me, the beef here are cuts of steak with teriyaki sauce. Me likes. It's not the best cut of beef (obviously) but I did enjoy it. I got 4 pieces of tempura for $1.15 more, that consisted of: shrimp, carrot, sweet potato and broccoli.

Lunch cost $10 after tax. I will be back.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I had time between sessions at my conference to grab lunch and I had my taste buds set on sushi.  This was about a block away and totally hit the spot!

The sushi was so fresh and sooo delicious.  I ordered the Rainbow Roll, Spicy Tuna, and Avocado Roll.  Reasonable prices for how fresh the fish was.  The mean came out at a decent time.  I think we waited about 15 minutes.  The place was packed.  My coworker laughed at me thinking that I wouldn't be able to eat it all but I did and loved eeeeevery bite.  :)  I wish they had one of these on the East coast.
author: Jean F.

description: Don't let the cheesy decoration fool you, the food is cheap and amazing. I had three veggie rolls and a soda for $12 dollars. If you come during lunch be prepared for a long line, but coming here is worth it.
author: Christian A.

description:
Tokyo Express is in a convenient location near the heart of the financial district. 

I was in the mood for some ramen, and the chicken ramen bowl they serve was exactly what I needed on a chilly day. It's a savory medley of sweet broth, barbecued chicken slices, tofu and what I assumed was spinach. It came with a tasty little salad. I also like that they offer water and a delicious green tea for free. 

I was tempted to steal a sample from a sushi roll my coworker was eating, but I'll try one of those on my next visit.
author: Alex L.

description: This is a fast-food place, but the food is good and expertly prepared. Ate there twice, both time sushi were good. Udon is run-of-the-mill and grilled chicken has no business to be in there. Absolutely unbeatable value is the middle of San Francisco.
author: Alonzo D.

description:
SOOooooooooooooo Whaaaaaaaaaaaat's UUUUUuuuuuuup!

Finally.

I have finally found my "Good Earth" equivalent in the financial district.

I am already smitten with Tokyo-Express.

I get butterflies in my stomach just thinking about them - and how lucky we are to have such an exciting new business open up so close to our office.

I have that "first month of dating" feeling about Tokyo-Express.

That giddy feeling - that makes me do a half run/half awkward speedwalk thing to this place (I am not a girl who runs - so that says a lot right there).  The whole time I'm ordering stuff here, I can barely stop myself from doing this annoying squeal thing - that I like to do when I'm excited. And then once I've ordered - all I can do is scan the menu fervently - just trying to decide what I'm going to order here next time I come.

Aaaaaaaaahhhhh sooooooooo good.

To quote Singles -  Tokyo Express - You rock my world. 

From their complimentary tea - 

To their brown rice (which I always get with a side of teriyaki sauce) - 

To their on point veggie rolls (tempura yam rolls, tempura tofu and other veggies, avocado and cucumber etc) - 

To their free samples of spicy fried California rolls  - yum! (their free samples always alternate and there is often a limited supply)

To their Salmon Don and/or Veggie Don over rice.

To their extensive menu - 

To their unreal prices.

To their clean efficient kitchen.

To their friendly wait-staff.

To the lack of line inside this place.

To the fact that I get a chance to walk down - classic compliment corner to get to my love.

Tokyo-Express  - I see a beautiful and bright future for us both.

I've already planned many future dates in my mind.

Many.

I can't wait to get this relationship thing rolling.

(the 4 star is just because I'm planning on taking things slow with Tokyo Express. I have a feeling they will be graduating to 5 stars shortly.)

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
this place gets the job done, i'd say at a pricey cost but understandably so, it's downtown. I don't think it's one dollar sign tho. probably more like two. 

the fish is decent but fairly small pieces and the udon is udon. this isn't an area with much selection for japanese so it's decent.
author: Janet Y.

description: Delicious food & very neat place. I love the New York rolls. Food is cheap & the employees are friendly.
author: Maritza S.

description: High quality Sushi at a fair price. That's more than I can say for a lot of sushi restaurants around town. Seems these days like good sushi is a luxury. It's great to have a place that serves this type of great food for practical people. The restaurants feng shui is a bonus too, even if I do normally just pick up. More beer selection would be great, would not be bad to see some IPA'S in there but Asahi does hit the spot with sushi so you'll hear no complaints from me. I definitely recommend it.
author: Dan B.

description:
even though this restaurant layout suggest it's more like Fastfood, the sushi is actually quite fresh.  I give it 4 star since the sushi is good and the price is really reasonable.  I love their bento box with Steak, tuna sashimi and tempura. and the Udon here as well - great broth.  Staff is really friendly as well

I also love their rolls -  Kamakaze rolls and tempura shrimp rolls are my favorite... The only rolls I wouldn't suggest are the flash fried ones.  I don't know if I like the fried rolls anywhere.  Just a weird texture.

overall, love coming here before or after a movie nearby
author: Lei H.

description: I love this Japanese restaurant, the prices are modest for San Francisco ! The sushi,sashimi is always fresh and delicious. I like their Bento Boxes, especially the Terriyaki chicken that comes with miso soup, steamed rice, salad, a few slices of tuna sashimi.You get to help yourself to unlimted hot tea, kimchi, and water ! The waiters and waitresses are polite and courteous ! All the menus and prices are on the wall, so you pick the one that looks appealing to your taste buds, what you see is what you get !! If you need a hearty affordable quick Japanese meal this is the place to be in hectic busy expensive downtown San Francisco !
author: KC L.

description: I would definitely not reccomend this place to a friend. If you are looking to spend on great sushi for a great price, look ELSEWHERE. I ordered 2 orders of Super Dynamite here and was only given 5 pieces each order, totalling 10 pieces, and was charged extra for Spicy mayo when that usually comes FREE in ALL OTHER Sushi restaurants. The cashier taking the order was extremely rude, charging a total of over $26.00 for barely 10 pieces of sushi, which did not tasted horrible especially for such an expensive price. She had the audacity to charge for spicy mayonaise on the side which were small containers measuring  2 centimeters, only good to cover barely one sushi. I was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED with this place. In addition to that, she was extremely rude. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. This place was absolutely not worth it and if zero stars were possible then that is what I would have rated. VERY DISSAPPOINTED.
author: Maliyah B.

description: I had nice vegetarian option where vegetables were fresh and in season and rice was sweet and not sticky with lumps as it happens very often in other places.
author: Tatsiana N.

description: Good sushi place if you want your food fast and cheap. Order their Chicken Tempura as usual and a side of California rolls. The food is pretty okay for the price you are paying for. All you have to do is order at the counter and they give you a number for you table and the waiter will bring your food over for you. I considered this place a fast food restaurant but they actually has service which is a plus.
author: Peter C.

description: Amazing deals, and it's happy hour prices every day from 3-6 pm on certain items, like California Rolls. No, it is not gourmet, but it's affordable, fast and they bring it out to you--and they have a liquor license, which means they serve hot sake. It's central to Yerba Buena and Metreon. It is not spotless, true. But, other than that, what's not to like? BTW, the Rock-n-Roll is decent and you won't find a 2 buck seawood salad anywhere else in the City; what they charge 2 bucks for you can find for no less than 7 bucks--and more like 10--at any other restaurant.
author: Dave S.

description:
A new branch of Tokyo Express opened today. http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/2CeyZzrapkBZSQxLxu31uA/l.jpg Really popular with SF downtown office workers for the value priced lunch deals (most items under $10). Almost every single FiDi office I've ever worked at has ordered catering from one of their locations. Sushi is decent for catering purposes. Not crazy about the teriyaki, because the strips of meat (beef and chicken) are often a little dry, so I'd usually choose salmon. http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9fqL-BkTSyqFA7pvYNsZqw/l.jpg Tempura is fine. (overall Sanraku inside the Metreon is better) The space is very clean and spacious. Place your order at the register and then take a seat. http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ssf3mYQ9iTrAV4U6x5cBgQ/l.jpg Free self-service water and hot tea on the left counter. http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jP5UhHhaNDDEkOP1z_Tzcw/l.jpg Bathrooms on the left. Service is very friendly.

There are a few sushi rolls in plastic containers on the counter, for those who want to make a quick purchase. The California rolls are good. **Update: now all rolls are made to order.

This is a great location with plenty of seating. http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ArC86S8AC-DLJemRKIfgew/l.jpg They're gonna get a ton of business from Moscone Center convention attendees and City College students next door.
author: Luis C.

description: The food was pretty bad and the unhappy employees did not make the place any better. My food came with a fried egg on top--with a bit of crunchy egg shell still in it (yum)--and steamed veggies that were very cold.
author: Kavir D.

description: The food was average but they serve you quickly which makes it convenient during a short lunch break. I liked the miso soup the most.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Not your normal Japanese restaurant, but more of an order and sit-down wherever you want place.

A friend looked up Yelp for this place before meeting up, since a) we wanted Japanese food and b) we didn't want to spend an arm and a leg for it. She managed to find this place since it was close to where I was staying and close to the Powell Station for BART.

Entering the place, I was kind of taken back at the set up, how you order the food and find your own seat (sans server). I guess the thing about that is that you save cost, so you only have to worry about clean up.

Good thing about this place, prices are decent, in comparison from all the other SF places I've ate at. And the flavors weren't too bad, at least in my salmon teriyaki don. I had a few sneaks of sushi rolls off my friend's plate, and it was a decent taste. Not too fancy like something you'll get at a sushi-ya, but nothing cheap like something you would pick up from a supermarket that came in a bentou box.

I would highly recommend this place, if you're in one of those "cheap and lazy" dinner moods.

A BIG PLUS: free hot tea! You don't get that everywhere!
author: Tom T.

description: A friend of mine, her sister, sister's friend, and I went here for a lunch yesterday - it was OK. There were quite a bit of people for lunch at 12:30PM so I guess that's a good sign. My friend had a special roll (can't remember the name) which was good but mine (the double salmon) was not really that great. First of all, it was puny. Second, the rice was falling apart. Thirdly, there was so little salmon in it -____-" hmf.
author: Sarah K.

description: Great food for the price. Quality, presentation, quantity, and preparation. This is a solid place, and great for refueling before or after shopping.
author: E. W.

description:
Cheap, affordable Japanese "fast" food. 
Since I've given up being a vegetarian, I've tried a few of their bentos. I like the chicken lemon basil best ($6.99). I've tried their vegetarian Donburi too, but I would not recommend it. I think their bentos are very affordable and they offer good portions, I usually can't finish it. Customer service is good, nothing to complain about, very polite and friendly people.
author: Sam T.

description:
It's been a while since I've had Japanese food so I looked up a cheap japanese spot and here it went.

I came in around 2:30 on a Saturday.  As I had hoped it wasn't very busy.  I came in and ordered the Salmon Teriyaki (to go) which came with a small salad and miso soup (a very pleasant surprise; It was probably written somewhere and like a moron I didnt read it).

I got to where I was going, situated myself, and started with the miso soup.  It was great, and with my travels it was the perfect temperature.

Next I ate the salad.  The salad was very good, my only complaint was that they could have used a lot less dressing.  After I finished there was still a good 3/4 - 1 ounce of dressing leftover.  That said, it was still very delicious.

Finally, the Salmon Teriyaki.  There was about 8oz's worth of salmon in 4 pieces laid on a small bed of cabbage and a generous amount of teriyaki sauce.  Of the 4 pieces, 3 were overcooked and a little leathery but otherwise tasted great (I still ate the salmon.  I'm not a fussy eater, this is just an observation).  

The rice was normal.  I was hungry so would have liked more, but not a problem.

Before I forget, they gave two orange slices with the meal.  I know this sounds weird but those were really really good orange slices.  I'd like to know where they get their oranges from.

Overall a decent experience, I probably wouldn't come back for the food again (Nothing amazing about it), but it was definitely worth what I paid and experiences.  I will have to come back and try out their sushi though.

Cheers!
author: Vasken O.

description: pretty bad, wanted sushi because i wanted something healthy. the gyoza is mostly fried flour, the wakame was slimy, the rice in my avocado rolls was stale and weirdly translucent, and the miso soup was alright but not fresh either
author: Cara D.

description:
Tokyo Express definitely fills my need for a decent sushi place close to work, usually pretty quick and not too pricy, so even though this is not the best sushi place in town I end up going there quite a lot!

The fish is fresh and portions are very decent for the price. It just lacks a bit of variety and exoticness as they only have the basics (salmon, tuna, shrimp, cooked eel and yellowtail).

Recommended if you're in Soma and just need your daily sushi fix, if you want something more fancy you can find more interesting places around.
author: Jules O.

description:
From the outside, my friends and I thought it was a sort of ghetto janky place, but we were absolutely WRONG.
The inside was (seemed) very clean and the design of the tables and the menu was very classy and organized. I was quite impressed with the interior... anyways... we ordered food right away and it was a good price! I got a huge portion of chicken teriyaki chicken don over rice ($7.17 including tax, salad, and miso soup) and my friend ordered tempura udon ($7.17 with tax). My sister got two rolls for $13! It was a REALLY good deal for two rolls and she was quite impressed. However another friend's portion (salmon roll) seemed very small. It was quick order and the orders came out within 3-5 minutes we ordered! PRAISE THE LORD.

I would rate the teriyaki chicken a 3.5/5 -- the serving size was huge and the rice was perfectly cooked, but the sauce was a little watery and not as thick as I had wished it would be. The complementary greens were perfect and fresh! However the salad's sauce (complementary) was too empowering and gave off a bit bitter taste.
I also had part of the udon bowl and I would rate it 3/5. The udon was cooked perfectly, however the tempura was REALLY oily and greasy and after having one broccoli I had to stop.

Overall: If you want a quick order but really good place with portions and pretty decent quality food, this is the place to go. But if you want really really quality food and you're picky with the freshness and the sauces, this would still be a pretty decent place to go to.
author: Sonia L.

description: This place is really unprofessional.  I ordered 3 different rolls and recieved 2. After 15 minutes of waiting for the 3rd roll my wife asked for a refund. The waiter, an overweight darker skin asian guy, got really upset and yelled "We told you it would take 10 minutes to make! Here's your food right here!" My wife told him that his customer service sucks and all she wanted was a refund. He yelled, "whatever b*tch!" to my wife and walked away. He caused a whole scene in front of a dining room full of customers over us wanting a refund. Some of the other patrons were so upset they left and said they wouldn't be back. Needless to say I will not be back here. It was really unnecessary and offensive that he would so easily call my wife out of her name over a refund. -1 star
author: Jelina A.

description: There is free tea. It's clean. They have picture menus so you can just point to what you want. The sushi is pretty good. Katsu is good but will take a while because they fry it fresh. When it is busy you may wait a while. When it is not busy, you will wait less. It is close to Moscone Center. It is affordable. They sometimes play Korean karaoke videos on the TV. I go there a lot, but maybe you shouldn't because I don't like waiting in line.
author: Jen P.

description:
This place has a great happy hour deal if you are walking around down town.  It is much better than eating at the food court in the Westfield mall, just a few doors down.  

You order your meal at the counter and get a number to set at your table and the food comes out to you.  They have some really good serve your own tea too. I like the ice tea, its always refreshing.  They also have some alcohol there.  

The Lemon Basil Chicken is really good.  The sushi is average.  But all the food hits the spot.
author: Cecilia D.

description: mcdonalds of sushi joints in fidi. Definitely a fast lunch goto but every once in a while they do let me down with the sushi rolls. For the price I don't complain but it always makes me wary about coming back the next time. I think I'll just stick with the tonkatsu or other lunch special favorites  but the best I could give this place is 3 stars.
author: Norris T.

description:
You're better off eating the papules off a bum's scrotum than expecting quality sushi here. I came here out of desperation...I was in the neighborhood and figured "why not?" A friend of mine said she had eaten there before so we walked in. 

By "Tokyo Express" they mean "McDonald's drive-thru Sushi". 
"Never fresh, always frozen" is their motto. 

I am writing this review after 5 separate sub par experiences!

If I could give 0-stars, I would. This is trash in your mouth!! I cant!

I swear this place has given me the shits every time I've come here, yet I always think "maybe it was just that one time" but NOOOO it's every time. How the fuck do you mess up an avocado roll?! omfg. Rock hard avocado wrapped in seaweed is just disturbing. FROZEN salmon is just disrespectful...serve me shit on a plate, why dont you? 

Save yourself the drama and just go to a real sushi restaurant.
author: Lydia L.

description: It wasn't even crowded. Three other customers here on thanksgiving eve. Ordered the caterpillar roll with California roll $10 special. Took 25 minutes for my order to arrive and customers who arrived after got their orders way faster than me!
author: Kevin D.

description:
Yes this sushi place is very good but I think the flavor can be better. It's like a fast food place but instead of selling hamburgers they have sushi instead.

Keep in mind it's a casual place so If you are on a budget then this is your place. If you are thinking to take your date here I recommend you find another sushi spot.

Four stars because it's affordable and customer service is great.
author: Joe K.

description: This place is legit. Incredibly fast service. Pretty good sashimi. Reasonable prices. So far, the best sushi place in the Financial District in SF during the work day.
author: Mel G.

description: Solid place for sushi in the City. It's my "go-to" sushi place during the work week. Prices are reasonable. Service is okay, but reasonable. Remember: cheap sushi isn't good and good sushi isn't cheap!!! Thank you for having good sushi at a good price!
author: Jeff S.

description: I love Tokyo Express for several reasons. The  food is not only great, but the portions are huge, and the prices are low. Thankfully, they have a location close to my home. The teriyaki is some of my favorite, and I usually can't finish the whole meal, which comes with salad and miso soup. Another amazing thing I love is, they are super honest. On Friday night, I left my nearly new MacBook Air in a bag, hanging on the back of a chair. I missed it at home, but they were closed, so I had to wait until morning to check if it was there. One of their people found it and put it in the office for safe keeping. I was ecstatic that it wasn't stolen. I love this place even more now. Tell Sugar or Philip that Randy said HI.
author: Randy S.

description: Unfortunately the tempura i ordered was really not very fresh. The sashimi was ok though. In general i would say this is a rather fast food, low-quality (but also low priced) japanese restaurant. Not recommended
author: Ioannis K.

description: Happy Hour prices here are amazing!  Tokyo express has become my wife and I's go to sushi place when we are downtown.  I'm sure there are other places that I just haven't experienced, but for the price Tokyo Express has good quality sushi.
author: Nick M.

description:
This is a great new addition for your downtown lunch choice.  Tokyo Express doesn't look like much from the street, but once you get inside it's large, bright, and clean.   The ambiance reminds me of some of the places I actually ate at in Tokyo.   The menu choices are broad, servings sizes are large, and prices are reasonable (much better than the nearby Westfield food court).

I've had the Chicken Terriaki, Chicken Donburi, Edamame, and several types of sushi and sashimi.  All were as good if not better than other local Japanese restaurants I've tried (including some in Japan Town).
author: Ed J.

description:
This is a good option for a sushi craving at work.  It's a 5 minute walk and the place is clean and quick.  There's also plenty of room inside if you want to eat in.

I had the soft shell crab roll (spider roll).  I got the 8 piece but it came with more like 9 pieces.  I liked that.  The soft shell crabbed was a little overfried and brown but it hit the spot.  The pieces were quite large.  2-3 bites each for me.  I could only finish 5 for lunch and saved the rest for later.  I don't recommend saving the rolls here.  Edible but not as tasty the next day.

So as well as rolls they have sushi, sashimi, tempura and various udon soups.  I'm really curious about the udon soups so I'll be back.
author: Jean K.

description: Place is good and their food is awesome. Service it's good too, very friendly. The only thing that I didn't like were their bathrooms(dirty bathrooms, dirty kitchen)makes me wonder...The bathrooms were dirty and one of the sinks were broker, you can tell that they don't bother to keeping them clean.
author: Vilma C.

description: I ordered and finished my lunch without my miso soup and salad; the waitress forgot them. The second time that happened.
author: Justin N.

description:
My co-workers and I discovered this place last week and all of us felt in love! 

This place has enough room to seat all sushi lovers.

Menu is very big and sushi taste fresh and delicious. I've been ordering Combo B...

Highly recommend it!
author: Anelya S.

description:
Like Sunny H., I'm very disappointed that prices have gone up, portion size has gone down, and quality is so-so.

They must have heard they were in SoMa and deserved to be more expensive.

Tokyo Express used to be my go-to for lunch in the area. I would have given it 4 stars before the prices jumped. It was kind of a fast-food joint but it was a terrific value.  Now it's still a fast-food joint but isn't any less expensive or any better than that Japanese place in the Metreon center food court, which offers nicer surroundings.
author: Crabcakes C.

description: Got me an order ahead order after they closed and gave me rice while spilled everything and made a mess. Sushi and sashimi are fresh and inexpensive.
author: Stephen L.

description: Just had lunch here, I ordered a "Caterpillar" roll. apparently they make their rolls here with tempura shrimp instead of eal.
author: Becky H.

description: There must be prostitutes running the place because you get the most bang for your buck and they always hook you up.  Happy hour (3-6) they have deals 75% cheaper than anywhere else in the city.  And it's good! Now after spending $12 I have left overs for 2 more meals.  $3 California rolls are hard to believe  and great. Seriously though this place is the bomb,  and if you pay with LevelUp it's even more unbelievably affordable and awesome.
author: Brandon N.

description:
So I saw the sign outside for everything that they had and I felt like Gavin a sake 
I've been eating sushi for about 15 years now
So I go up to the counter and order a sake and she asks me of I want it Hot or cold and i told her it doesn't matter 
Then she said I have to order something with it again she asked me what I want and again I told her it doesn't matter because like I stated before I have been eating sushi for 15 years now there isn't any thing Japanese I won't eat that they could give me so the total comes to under ten and I give her a twenty
She gives me a number and says they will bring it out to me
So in about five minutes my waiters bring  me hot sake and my California roll
Sake was good I think that was my first time having warm alcohol 
But I have had sake before this time 
I get sushi all the time from the grocery store so this california.  Roll was nice and fresh for a change  great !
I ate my food in about ten minutes took my plate to the front then left and buck tip in the tip jar
I will come back
author: Jennifer G.

description: This place is really quaint.  I think that's the best way to describe it.  The food isn't incredible, but it's definitely noteworthy.  They have free tea that you can serve for yourself.  They also have a fantastic combination of sushi, nigiri, donburis, and other rice bowls.  This place is absolutely great for lunch, but it's less of a dinner atmosphere.  Definitely check this place out if you're looking for a quick and yummy bite to eat.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Popped in here today for a quick takeout lunch. Interior looked good for sit-down too, but definitely a business lunch kinda place, nothing fancy. Menu was laid out pretty nice, staff was friendly, service was quick.

I got deluxe bento and was not disappointed; a lot of good food for about $12, definitely a good value for this area. In contrast, my coworkers went to the mall and spent $15 on about half as much food from Kichi Grill.

Deluxe bento consists of Salmon Teriyaki (small portion but welcome because there was so much other food, tasty sauce and not dry), mixed tempura (shrimp was super tasty), Sushi (2 nigiri and 3 cali roll pieces, all tasty), salad (pretty standard), and miso soup (a little bland but decent).

Far from the best bento I've ever had, but good, fast, and cheap; I'm definitely coming back here to try more of their menu.
author: Anthony P.

description:
Deliciousness! They just opened today? ... Anyways, I tried their Lemon Basil Chicken and it was yummers!

They're offering free samples, too!... So glad to have a quick japanese/sushi place a block from the office. Mall food is soo overpriced compared to this stuff.
author: Andrew C.

description: Great sushi. The cashier was very patient and nice. I wanted a baked roll, he suggested the tiger roll. It was really good! Prices were very reasonable. There is a lot of seating. If you have kids this place would be okay.
author: Oberto O.

description:
I come here relatively often since it's so close to work. Every time I walk through the door I'm a little disappointed with myself. 

The sushi is very cheap and it tastes that way. Not terrible- just okay. But again, it is cheap! The udon is udon, not a bad call if it's chilly outside and you're hungry inside. 

You could do better. You know you could. But if you're in the neighborhood I guess it wouldn't hurt to stop by...
author: Ryan D.

description: Order forgotten at this location. Waited a solid 20 minutes  before asking where my order was. Visited around 5:30 on a weekday. I usually go here for my sushi fix when I'm in the area.
author: Ryan K.

description: I come here often for a shushing fix. It's not fancy, it's fairly priced and casual.  They also sell beer and saki.  I usually order the blossom Chirashi it comes with soup and salad.  There is a self serve hot tea, iced tea, and water station.  Look for the bento specials posted by the cash register for dinner/lunch plates around $7.50.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Good  stuff I like that food. I always  go to eat in that place  after  school, but recently  I go and the server when I order  always  confuse the order and add something  different . Always  happens  with the guy name ""ERNESTO"" happen most of the time.  That is good place good food, but the only thing is not good is the service, when  they serve the food not too kindly and friendly.   Maybe that guy  is the manager of that  restaurant  that right  happens  the same situation
author: Sanchez R.

description:
Our 7:10 pm movie at the Metreon ended around 9:40 pm on a Friday night. We didn't feel like driving or walking too far and since we were both pretty hungry, we decided to give this place a shot.

Tokyo-Express came up on Yelp as a nearby restaurant which reviewers described as fast food sushi. I agree with that description: it was fast, cheap and average food (below average sushi from all of the sushi experiences I had). 

It definitely fit the bill of what we wanted, though, since it was late and kind of cold and windy. I really didn't feel like hunting down the perfect place, especially at this hour.

I had the Sushi Combo plate B, which included sushi, California rolls, and came with miso soup and salad. My boyfriend got a chicken katsu bowl, which he liked.

The fish quality and rice was mediocre, but we got our food within 5 minutes, which was nice. Free hot tea and iced tea (plus small containers of kimchi if you happen to notice it when you're ordering at the counter).

A solid 3 star rating for this fast, convenient sushi place.
author: Jen B.

description:
If you work downtown or happen to be there and craving sushi, This is definitely your place to go for a fast and casual lunch. It's right across from The Metreon and next to the mall. There is always a day where you really crave sushi, mine was today. I'm never really that impressed with the sushi options downtown, but when you want sushi, sometimes Tokyo-Express it is. 

They have daily specials that are pretty rad. I usually take my food to go, but there's plenty of seating. I'd go for the shirmp/vegetable tempura, lemon basil chicken with rice, soup, and a salad for $6.99 or their 8-piece Caterpiller or 49er roll that's usually $7-$8. They have everything, it's fresh, it's fast, it's great.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Staff is great.the guy who helped me at the register was nice and friendly.food came fast and hot.although I got it to go, it's very yummy! Would come back again :)
author: Kimberlie M.

description:
I really like this place! I feel like there are not a lot of affordable places to get sushi in that downtown shopping area, and not a lot of convenient ones. This one you can just get your order, and eat. 

Long story short, I love eating the tekka maki roll (I usually get two cause it's pretty cheap), and the tempura roll. As long as the fish is fresh, I'll be coming here for a long time. I'm not looking for super high end or anything, just something that hits the spot.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Tokyo Express isn't exactly the most authentic Japanese restaurant places, but it's pretty fast and convenient.  It also serves a bunch of other Asian food, as the menu is pretty extensive.  Yes, it's more like food court fast food, but given the location and the prices, it's very reasonable.

You get complimentary hot tea and kimchee with any meal.  And then with what I ordered, I also got miso soup and a small salad.  The sushi is par-for-the-course Americanized Japanese food.  Definitely not high-brow, but quality is acceptable.

Very good place for fast, easy, reasonably priced Japanese/Asian food.
author: Claire J.

description: Every time I eat here I always feel a bit sick. Found a hair in my salad that comes with the chicken Teriyaki. I can see why there health score is so low. Bland, cheap..stomach always bubbles after I eat here. Pass this place up, it's convenient and reasonably priced by the quality and cleanliness is questionable.
author: Krissy A.

description:
Tokyo-Express is like a Japanese casual cafe - you order at the counter, grab a number, and a few minutes later a waiter delivers your food.  Serve yourself some tea/water while you wait.  I wouldn't exactly call it express or fast food (they make your food to order instead of having a pre-packed set), as it takes about 10 minutes for your dish to come out, but it's definitely faster than your average sushi joint.

Prices and taste were average (I got the nigiri combo with tempura), but if you're in the area you could definitely do worse.
author: Cathy Y.

description: I've stopped by here multiple times to pick up sushi on my way home. For the price, it's what I'd expect! I particularly enjoy their daily specials, and can usually find one that I'd enjoy, and the wait isn't too long - I haven't ever had to wait more than 10 minutes for my order.
author: Natalie K.

description:
Lemon on salmon on salmon.

Expectations were low for this unassuming sushi spot along Mission. Knew I was wrong after my first piece of the Double Salmon roll. Salmon inside. Salmon outside. Slices of lemon embedded on top.

Very innovative. Very good. Very well priced. Very impressed.
author: Jason B.

description: Going to this location for over two years now, never had any issues with food or service in the past until today.  I notice straight away they had another price increase , this is second one in last 6 months so they keeping getting more expensive.  Quality of food is always good and have no issue with food.  Today, like every other time, I asked for extra teriyaki sauce and the guy said that they normally charge for it, my response was that there must be a mistake because in two years, never have i been charged for an extra bit of sauce.  That got me bit angry , i went back to my table and was just checking my receipt and my entree was a higher charge on the actual receipt than that  listed on the menu by the counter.  It was only change ,but they could not explain why when i asked them.  Today, i found customer service slacking and another price hike, as much as i like the food here , i'm thinking its time to eat elsewhere int he future
author: Alan H.

description:
Tasty shiitake maki, spicy tekka maki, and futomaki rolls. Great service for a fast food sushi joint.

Reviewed and saved in Feb 2012, but Yelp wouldn't allowed posting via iPhone at that time.
author: L T.

description:
I love sushi but don't like to spend money on them.... So I decided to go to Tokyo Express and was definitely satisfied with the quality of the sushi.  My friend and I ordered quite a lot including beers, and the bill was around 40 dollars.  I went to this establishment twice during my stay in SF.  

Keep it up!
author: Hu P.

description: I went to tokyo epress for the first time and i loved it. Me and my friend where looking  to have sushi for lunch and spot that down the street from the mall the menu was great and the hot tea was good. they give  u tofu soup which was my first time trying and i loved it.  the food filled me up and the atmosphere was great and good price
author: Elizabeth G.

description: I have to say I found this spot because of Yelp while looking for a quick meal after a movie, I can't complain about a thing, and the prices when I ate at night was about what you would expect to pay for lunch else where, very reasonable.  The staff was very enthusiastic and pleasant, Ill be back for sure.
author: Keyth S.

description:
The service was not very great. It was definitely busy but they still seemed very rushed and unwilling to help. Just wanted to get you in and out.

The atmosphere was okay, not bad. Kind of fun with all the business. Food was also okay. I mean, its SF, so there's about a dozen better places around the corner.
author: Thach N.

description: Came here cause me and my friends were starving and wanted a quick, cheap dinner. Unfortunately we were in downtown and all the restaurants around were super fancy and pricy. Decided to just come in here. When I saw that it was japanese fast food I didn't expect much. But actually, the food wasn't bad. It came out quick and the quality was pretty decent/ comparable to restaurant quality. I think it's also awesome that they have free kimchee. Can't go wrong with that.
author: Christina L.

description: 2 stars may be an overstatement, but I'll let them have it because the food was decent. On the other hand, the service was horrible. Every staff member I encountered was rude, in a hurry, and appeared sincerely pissed off. There were at least 10 tables that hadn't been cleared of dishes, leaving my group of 3 no choice but to sit at the bar which wasn't great for group conversation.
author: Lauren H.

description: I don't know about the rest of their menu, but their sushi is awful, the atmosphere is like a cafeteria, the service was lousy and did I mention the sushi was awful. This place might be easy on your wallet but not so easy on your stomach. If you like fresh, quality sushi, go some where else.
author: Eric M.

description: We stopped by here after finding out the wait for surrounding restaurants were 30+ minutes. Expectations weren't too high, but we left disappointed. One person ordered sashimi and found the fish to be still slightly frozen. My udon had some scallops in it that were terrible: dry and flaky. I actually had to spit it out into a napkin and I don't like wasting food. The waitress was nice but forgot several items we placed. Friendly staff for sure, but it seemed like a fast food type place.
author: Michael N.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend with hungery stomaches; craving japanese. So we shaered a bento box - chicken teriyaki, tempura and california roll.

The food was okay, tasted like other japanese we been to. It was cheap, but we both liked it.
author: Gen M.

description: This place is efficient, clean and spacious.  The katsu, california roll are good.  Lemon chicken was blah.  Great place to go for quick lunch if you're in the mood for rice.
author: Mr. C.

description:
I work around this area, and there really isn't that many good Japanese/Sushi places to choose from! -__- Unfortunately.  If you are in dire need of Japanese food, and don't want to head over to the Ferry Building, I guess you can stop here. 

Food: The food is sub-par.  All of the "teriyaki" foods are too sweet and artificial.  YUCK! I had the salmon terikayi here one time, HUGE mistake.  It was dry, over sweet, and tasted like plastic.  The seaweed salad is also very artificial tasting, which left a bad taste in my mouth.  I've eaten here twice (when I first started working in SF), but have not been back since (finding my fave spot Delica, in the Ferry Building).  

Ambiance/Service: The place is rather small, serve your own tea, and grab your own table.  You order and pay at the cash register, and then they bring you your food.  The service is relatively quick (I guess..), but if you need something while you're eating, no one is around to help you.. you have to walk back up to the register to ask.  Kind of frustrating.  

Overall, I would skip it and head over to Delica.  Better selection and definitely better quality! Plus! Its close by :)
author: Ashley M.

description:
Im surprised this place got 4 stars. Isn't this the same place in the Stonestown Galleria Food Court?

Anyways came here cause I was super hungry. Wanted some japanese food. I shared a bento box with my girlfriend. Got the teriyaki chicken, tempura and california roll.
